reviews.text: My first time eating here.  I didn&#39;t give a five star because of the green beans and bread. After we arrived we were seated immediately.  Our waiter was so kind and accommodating.  He brought us some bread; however, the sourdough crust was extremely hard, I asked him, &#34;Is it supposed to be this hard?&#34;  He said, &#34;Yes,&#34; but happily brought us some more warmed.  I got the herb crusted chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans.  The green beans were not cooked. I had to send them back, but they still weren&#39;t cooked, they squeaked when I tried to chew them, they were very disappointing.  Now, the chicken and potatoes I give a 100,  complements to the chef.
great place to eat. Food was exactly how we wanted. Made reservations and no problems getting our table.

Scrumptious cheesecake, fabulous decor, amazing service, enormous amount of food and great company is the Cheese Cake Factory.<br><br>This is my first visit to the location at Fhe Summit in Birmingham and it didn&#39;t disappoint.<br><br>My sis and I were in town for business and decided to enjoy the afternoon, in no hurry. <br><br>We don&#39;t usually get and appetizer because the servings are so large but decided to go for it. The eggroll sampler were very good. There was a different sauce for each one. They were crispy and full of flavor.<br><br>My sis got the burrito was was big enough for 4 people. She thoroughly enjoyed it and packaged the rest to go.<br><br>I ordered the Shepherds pie and it was outstanding!!! The consistency was of beef stuff with huge chunks of sirloin burger, huge chunks.  The mashed potatoes on top were from scratch. The bounty of potatoes carefully placed on top of the meat sauce, was the best I&#39;ve had ever. I ate 1/4, it was savory and the serving was enough for 2 hungry people who didn&#39;t plan on getting dessert. But hey it&#39;s the Cheese Cake Factory not the Shepherds pie Factory.<br><br>On to dessert, my sis got the Lemonchello Creme Torte with strawberries, so good. I got the white chocolate macadamia nut cheese cake and let me tell you it was so good.<br><br>Great food, great service and a week worth of double workouts at the gym, and green smoothies for a month was well worth it. <br><br>See ya next year Cheese Cake Factory, it&#39;s was good seeing you again.

Love, Love, Love me some Cheesecake Factory. I celebrated my 25th birthday there this past Sunday and they accommodated my party very well. I really wish they did reservations on the weekend; nevertheless, I got there early enough to get the desired wait time to put my party being seated at the time I wanted. <br><br>This isn&#39;t the first time I&#39;ve been here of course; but, I always get the Chicken and Biscuits because that is my go-to meal and OREO DREAM EXTREME CHEESECAKE (the best cheesecake in my opinion). Sometimes, if I&#39;m having a bad day...I&#39;ll drive from Tuscaloosa just to get cheesecake and wine. <br><br>I love the atmosphere and the staff is always so friendly. <br><br>I will be back, as always because my life is sometimes incomplete without cheesecake.

We visited Birmingham back in October for the Magic City Classic with my wife&#39;s family. Before I went plant-based, The Cheesecake Factory was one of to go places back in Maryland. Since going Plant-Based 2 years ago, I have not gone to a Cheesecake Factory but my wife&#39;s family was in the mood so we went. I was happy to see a veggie burger and the Impossible Burger served. I went with the Impossible burger with fries and this was possibly the best Impossible Burger I have had to date. It was so juicy and filling. I let my mother-in-law try it and she enjoyed it as this was her first time trying the Impossible Burger. The service was good and the wait not too bad for a busy Saturday night. It was great having Vegan Plant Based options even at The Cheesecake Factory in Birmingham, Alabama!

First of all &#34;wow&#34; the menu is a booklet long which worried me that a lot  can sometimes be too much to keep up and create a flavorful dish. But overall all the dishes that were order have been delicious. I got the  pasta dish while my husband got a taco dish which I don&#39;t recall the names. The warm bread is so good especially the brown one with butter which just feels like it dissolves right in my mouth. So for the cheesecake you can&#39;t go wrong with any and I tasted quite a few, and so far my favorite are red velvet and carrot. <br><br>So I will definitely come back to try more dishes and especially their cheesecake!

Always a good go to when you want a variety of options. The wait of course  is usually long, especially in weekends. When you have a small party the bar and high tops in the bar area are first come first serve, so grab one  and be seated faster. Portions are large. If you don&#39;t share a meal one option is that you can order lunch portions until 5:00, even on weekends. Another option is to order from the kids menu, they allow grown ups to do that. My all time favorite entree is the crusted chicken Romano. It is a pasta dish with Parmesan crusted chicken breasts that comes with a red marinara sauce. If you want to make it even better  ask for the white sauce and red sauce in the side  and mix the two yourself, it&#39;s delicious!!! Of course the cheesecake is phenomenal if it&#39;s your thing.

lol after being unable to eat here for a birthday dinner due to their hostess&#39;s behavior, we grabbed cheesecake to go - and found out when we went to celebrate that it was the wrong cheesecake (conveniently one that cost more!) and it was frozen

Cheesecake factory is always amazing. The service is always amazing. I really like the fact that they accept reservations through Yelp now so if you plan on going especially on the weekend I suggest you use Yelp to make a reservation.

We always find time to dine at The Cheesecake Factory when we are in town for baseball. It never disappoints. The food was once again delicious. This was our first visit since the COVID pandemic and social distancing restrictions so we were unsure of what to expect. Our wait time was actually less than we thought and the service was exceptional. Our waitress was Gabby and she did a phenomenal job. She was very courteous and professional and didn&#39;t miss a beat with our orders, refills, extra dressings and sauces or anything else. Unfortunately, masking takes away some of the human interaction but it was evident that Gabby had a smile underneath the mask. We will continue our CF tradition when we return.

A+ for greeting these weary travelers with a smile, 40 minutes before closing, on a Monday night.  David was an excellent waiter!<br>Posted calories changed my mind as to what I was going to order!  At Cheesecake Factory, I looked at calorie count, not price.  This restaurant chain does an excellent job of informing their customers of meal calories. <br>I ordered the steamed Edamame, 100 calories, $5.95<br>Hubs ordered the Classic Burger, 1340 calories,  $14.50 - Chop house burger with lettuce onion tomato and fries<br>My son ordered the Old Fashioned burger, 990 calories, $13.50  and fries. Additionally,  a piece of <br> Cinnabon Cinnamon Swirl Cheesecake  with vanilla crunch cake topped with cream cheese frosting and caramel.<br>Hubs hamburger was cooked perfectly, but my son&#39;s was dry. All in all, a very pleasant experience!
Over charged for food that was not cooked properly. Pasta stuck together. Salad served in hot bowl. Steak so chewy it was inedible. But the cheesecake was good as always

Our experience was fantastic!! Thanks to the best bartender/servers in Alabama... Krystal and Robin. When we first arrived, the meal and female host were rather rude and lacked personality. However, Krystal and Robin saved us. Their hospitality was above and beyond. I recommend the Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip or the Pot Stickers for an appetizer. Both packed flavor! Then the Chicken Madurai for an entree. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the sauce was text book perfect. Most importantly the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough or Oreo Cheesecake!!! This location has the best food of any Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve visited thus far, and as long as, Krystal and Robin are working, I would say the same for the service. Thanks for saving dinner ladies!!!

If you&#39;re looking for a place to eat during lunch with a variety of options, this is he place to go. I was there around 2:00 p.m. thinking that the lunch crowd would be gone, but I was mistakenly wrong. The wait time for a table was 30-45 minutes, with very minimal standing room due to the crowd and the flow of people continuing to increase. <br><br>Although the wait time was a negative, it was made up in the friendliness of the staff and promptness/correctness of our orders. We ordered fried macaroni cheese for our appetizer and it did not disappoint. The portion size was adequate and the presentation was nice. For the meals, I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and my guests ordered the four cheese pasta with steak. Everyone enjoyed their food and we were even happier to know that we could still order the lunch size portions after 2 p.m.

This location was excellent. They did a great job of making sure all COVID-19 protocols were done. The food was excellent and we enjoyed the atmosphere. Numbers are spiking again but once we get back to normal we will definitely be going back.

The Cheesecake Factory has never disappointed upon numerous visits.  The service is always great because the servers are personable.  The food is always great and made upon order.<br><br>I like their food, but I love their desserts.  Every time I eat here, I like to order the strawberry shortcake.  If I can, I like to share it because I can never finish it due to its massive size.  The short cake consists of ice cream, strawberries, and biscuits with sugar sprinkled on top of the biscuits.  The biscuits are homemade and fall apart when you touch them.  The strawberries are always fresh  and it&#39;s always just the right amount of ice cream.  That dish is addicting.  They also have an Oreo cheesecake that is to die for.  But this place has so many options for dessert that you&#39;ll always leave sati

We got here after the lunch rush. Pretty chill and we got a booth. <br><br>Lunch special was still going on so I got the margarita pizza and salad. My friend got lettuce wraps. We still got bread sent to the table. I love their brown bread. <br><br>We came here specifically for great food and to get our free slice of cheesecake.

The food is great, however the host Chris is a jackass. His attitude is so disrespectful towards the customers, and for my mother to hear him say &#34;this is why I hate old people&#34; I can&#39;t get over that. I refuse to eat at a restaurant that condone this type of behavior from their workers. Yesterday was her birthday and it was ruined because of his behavior and his comment. Management really needs to step in.

Came here to celebrate our brother&#39;s birthday. It was busy and so there was a wait, typical for cheesecake. The wait wasn&#39;t that bad. However, service was incredibly slow! By the time our food came out we had filled up on bread. The server was nice.

I generally have pleasant experiences when it comes to the Cheesecake Factory but this was not one of those times. In particular, the service was bad. The group of 3 I was a part of was greeted very nicely and that was probably the only thing that was nice about the service. <br><br>After we were served our drinks, the waiter left to give us some time to look at our menus. However, our waiter literally took 15 minutes to come back to us. 2. My friend went to the restroom and disclosed that there were 2 employees on their phone in the bathroom.<br>3. We had to ask our servicer three times to get more bread.  4. I asked for some BBQ sauce twice and never got it so I gave up trying. 5. We asked for our checks which took another 10-15min to get and our waiter took another 10ish min to come pick up the checks so we could pay and leave. Lastly, what is bad about all of this, it wasn&#39;t even busy. Over half of the restaurant was empty so I&#39;m not sure why there was such a delay in our service. There were 3 times, we asked another waiter for help or to get our waiter. The only reason I didn&#39;t give this  Cheesecake Factory a one star is because the food was still good. So kudos to the Chef but the service was
Quick and easy to access online ordering. The curbside pickup is quick and sufficient with ease of mind knowing I do not have to leave my vehicle.

What&#39;s not to like about the Cheesecake Factory? Why it has taken so long to review this place I have no idea. The food here is always fantastic, and has one of the largest menus I&#39;ve ever seen for a restaurant-I love choices!!! <br><br>Some of my personal favorites are the fried Mac n cheese balls, the Cajun pasta(I think it&#39;s called Louisiana Chicken pasta), their burgers, and of course any of the cheesecakes. I&#39;m not really a fan of the &#34;skinny&#34; cheesecakes, but other that you can&#39;t go wrong. <br><br>The service here is sometimes hit or miss, but the last couple of times here have been better. Expect a wait on the weekends, but know it&#39;s worth it! I will definitely continue to come here for special occasions and whenever I am craving some awesome cheesecake. Don&#39;t miss this staple up at the Summit!

Any time a restaurant&#39;s menu is the length of a novella, I have my doubts. I just don&#39;t know that you can be that good at that many dishes.  And to be quite honest, many of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s dishes are average to fine, but not phenomenal. The service is pretty top notch, however, and you can tell they pay attention to their customer service.  <br><br>On this last visit, we ordered the avocado egg rolls. One thing to note is that all portion sizes at Cheesecake Factory are MASSIVE (another drawback, in my opinion), and the egg rolls were no different. They were quite tasty, and I would order them again. <br><br>For my lunch I decided on the chopped salad. It was very heavy on the dressing, if I ordered it again I would get the dressing on the side. It was tasty, but due to the portion size I did not manage to finish it, and it was not the type of thing that would have kept well (avocado).  I hated to leave that much on the plate, but was absolutely stuffed and trying to save room for cheesecake. <br><br>We indulged in the Caramel Turtle Cheesecake, which was very tasty. That&#39;s one section of the menu I don&#39;t mind being generous.  <br><br>The service is very good here, but the parking can be a nightmare, especially at peak hours at the Summit.

Very busy night. The weather was cool but not freezing. There was a wait if 45-50 minutes for parties of around 3 (which was us) and a 2 hour wait for parties with 5 or more. Geeesh. We were able to walk to some other shops while waiting to be buzzed for a table. We got buzzed at around the 35 minute mark. Nice booth seat out of the way. Seats were filthy and we had to clean them off ourselves. <br><br>The bread eventually came when it was done baking. So it was soft and hot. I am not understanding for the life of me why places serve their butter ice cold. By the time you get done trying to forcefully spread it on the bread it&#39;s not ok. The bread is smushed or  cold. <br><br>I ordered the chicken picatta as it&#39;s the only thing I ever order from here. Their menu is entirely too big and trying to decide on something new just isn&#39;t worth it for me. I always order my picatta with extra sauce bcus the pasta always need it bcus of how it&#39;s served. My chicken was tender. My pasta was cooked well and the sauce was delicious and had plenty of capers like I love. <br><br>I also tried Kese&#39;s Caesars salad and it was delicious. I normally don&#39;t like them bcus of the lack of flavor but this one was delicious and dressed well. <br><br>Kese and Kylah also tried and loved the raspberry lemonade. They literally had 4 glasses so I suggest giving that a try too lol. My sweet tea wasn&#39;t disappointing either.

First time at this location and first ever brunch at The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Seated immediately. Server took drink order promptly.<br><br>I chose the Fried Chicken and Waffles. Serving was a good blend of sweet and savory. Chicken was nice and crisp. Waffle was not as done as I prefer, too soft even before the syrup.<br><br>Shortly after we arrived at 11, crowd started building and was packed with waiting parties by the time we finished and were leaving. So if you are coming for brunch get there by 11.
Good menu variety - of course it is a chain, but the food taste better than the average chain to us.

I&#39;m usually not too into large fine dining chain restaurants but my parents were in town and wanted to eat here. We arrived and sat outside on their heated patio because there was no wait time for that. Service was very friendly but just a tad slow! No points off there though, our server was awesome. <br><br>We started off with crab cakes and a mild guacamole and chips. The crab cakes were amazing, fried perfectly with a nice moist interior. The guac was good but I would suggest not getting mild because it was a little too bland but nevertheless still very good and well made.<br><br>For our main courses, I had a gumbo with rice which was actually really nice on the cold night out on the patio. It had a hefty amount of protein and tasted great. I&#39;m actually not sure what my mom ordered but it had some massive shrimp on it. Really the only reason I&#39;m giving this place a 4 is because my dads New York strip steak came out well done when he ordered it medium. <br><br>Although the steak was disappointing, everything else was on point and I would recommend giving this place a shot if you haven&#39;t. They have a giant menu so you&#39;re bound to find something you like!

We have been to The Cheesecake Factory several times and I&#39;ve always had a good visit, this one was as well! We placed reservations for 2 pm and showed up right on time. I would say the Hostesses were not very welcoming as all 3 of them were talking with a gentleman manager with glasses and I was finally acknowledged/greeted after they were done with there personal conversation. I would say it&#39;s just common curtesy for at least one of the Hostesses to separate themselves from the conversation and greet the guest. After being seated, our experience was fabulous from start to finish. Our waiter was very attentive but not overbearing, had wonderful suggestions, knew the menu well (which is difficult I can imagine) and followed through with every request from start to finish. A++ for him! Our food was delish as well! We&#39;ll be back sooner I promise, hopefully to some Hostesses with guest services in mind!
Great food and  service. <br><br>The Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane was awesome. Everyone was pleased. <br><br>Scotch was excellent!<br><br>Ashely our server was terrific!

I hate to leave one star but honestly if I didn&#39;t have to put one, I wouldn&#39;t. This was my first time going last weekend and we had a reservation at 6pm. We get there at 5:45 and let them know we are there. We see other people waiting in this room, so we decide to get out of the way and wait in there also. A brown haired lady comes and rudely tells us that &#34;we need to get out of that room&#34;. We then heard her being rude to other people and started to feel very uncomfortable. Our table finally gets ready at 6:15 and for them to be at half capacity, the serves was extremely slow! We waited forever on refills. The silverware had spots on it and my fork was bent. I got the lasagna and it was horrible, my husbands had the pasta napoletana  which was also  horrible. We ordered cheesecake and it took 30 minutes just to get original cheesecake. Needless to say we were not impressed!

Ok. This may be long. I have never been here, but have ALWAYS wanted to try it. I THOUGHT they were worthy of my 30th Birthday celebration...30!!...basically a major milestone. Went in, not much of a wait, waited about 10 minutes. Not bad. They had the Astros world series game on..major plus!! Loved it. Ordered a 9 oz glass of Pinot Grigio, not the best wine, but no complaints, honestly. We ordered an appetizer of edamame, because I can&#39;t do without it if it&#39;s on the menu. There was a little wait on the bread and app, but I was there for a good time, so the wait didn&#39;t bother me. I ordered the shrimp scampi combination with steak Diane, which  COMES WITH A SIDE OF POTATOES. Look at their menu. The other people in my party ordered and we waited a while..no biggy. I had my big glass of wine, so I was good. I thought. The wait was really long, so we asked what was taking so long. They weren&#39;t all that busy, I could see some open booths/tables. Our food finally arrived and I got JUST the shrimp scampi. (Remember, I ordered the combination with shrimp scampi and steak Diane WITH potatoes). So, I alerted the staff that my order was incorrect. The manager came over and said, no big deal, we&#39;ll get the steak out to you and you can have te whole rest of shrimp scampi. That was nice. So, not too long later the manger, Jennifer, came out and slammed my plate on the table and said &#34;here&#39;s your steak and I gave you an order of potatoes in case you wanted those&#34;. It honestly took a second to register, but EXCUSE ME, my original order CAME with potatoes. You didn&#39;t do me a favor. Please refer to your menu regarding the combination of steak Diane and shrimp scampi, IT COMES WITH POTATOES. Anyways, I was mad after that and was ready to go. I&#39;m sure the food was good, but literally packed it up in my to go box because I was livid. The only person saving this review from being 1 star is the ACTUAL waiter. He was nice and even asked if I wanted a to go cheesecake for my birthday. I wish I would have gotten his name, because he was amazing during this whole experience, it was the manager Jennifer that needs to be replaced ASAP. Don&#39;t recommend.

If you&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory before, this one is as good as they get around here. I&#39;ve been here probably 8+ times and each time the food is delivered promptly, hot, and perfectly to our liking. The portions here are large, and are great for taking half home for another meal. They&#39;ll even box it up for you afterwards!<br><br>Highlights include any chicken and cream-based pasta dish, the Bang Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp, and the Parmesan Chicken &#34;Pizza.&#34; Oh, and the cheesecakes are outta this world, of course! The menu is like an encyclopedia of food, and every taste can be satiated here.

Went for a late lunch on last Thursday. Wanted to sit on the patio and enjoy the beautiful weather and mild temps. Was told outdoor dining was closed but could not be given a reason. As it turned out many of the employees were apparently using it for a break area instead of allowing customers to access it. My wife asked for a Hurricane and even though they have a full bar and 2 bartenders the waitress returned stating &#34;we can&#39;t make those&#34; again without being given a reason as to why. Ordered a domestics beer and was charged $6!!! $6 for a domestic beer is ridiculous!!! This place is overrated and I don&#39;t plan to go back unless it&#39;s someone else&#39;s choice to go.

Food is always trash. I met two girlfriends today to have drinks and ordered a salad. (They got my salad wrong) They didn&#39;t have the appetizer my friends wanted so they just had drinks. One friend had three mimosas and a mix drink. Other friend had two glasses of wine. We sat outside and weren&#39;t being loud or belligerent. I HAD TWO MIMOSAS and was cut off for what?? Bc we were there for a little over an hour and didn&#39;t order a meal? Come on. We are big tippers and the waitress made a horrible judgement call. I will never go back. From one server to another... do better sis.

This Cheesecake Factory is consistent with the others. So that&#39;s a good thing. Our server was awesome. Very upbeat and friendly. <br><br>I ordered the salmon off the skinny menu. It was really good! My husband got the chicken salad sandwich also off the same menu and he really liked his. Our daughter got the Asian salad off the regular menu. It was huge. It was more like a family sized salad!<br><br>The night we came it was very busy but we were seated right away. We didn&#39;t order any dessert but I&#39;ve had the cheesecake here before and it is fabulous! Big enough for two.

We love to bring our boys (11, 9, and 8) here when we&#39;re in town. Great food, plenty of leftovers, and delicious cheesecake. Tonight, our server, Rusty, blew it out of the water! He is gregarious, knowledgable, and so helpful with explaining menu items. He made our experience FANTASTIC! Our youngest told me to tell you, &#34;Rusty is the BEST server he has ever had!&#34;

Im usually a fan of cheesecake and have been many times..And i really wanted to give them a higher rating. However, they have gotten rid of my 3 favorite items on their menu: Endive Salad, Eggplant Parmesan and Chris&#39; outrageous cheesecake..thank GOD they still have the Korean Fried Cauliflower which is a must have and is always delicious. Also got the fettuccine alfredo + mushrooms it was just okay..the cheese flavor wasnt as cheesy as i like. The service was really great though. Overall an average experience i hope they bring back some of the items or put some better vegetarian options on the menu soon!
My food was delicious and packaged perfectly. This was the best to go order experience I&#39;ve had since Covid-19.

PERFECT. I come here so much and it&#39;s usually hit or miss. Sometimes it&#39;s perfect sometimes it&#39;s terrible but I LOVE the salmon sooo much Im always willing to risk it. This experience was really nice . The only issue I had was they were so crowded we had to sit outside. They had heaters but it was still pretty cold. Also, I ordered two alcoholic beverages and the server brought me the wrong drinks twice. Other than that, my food was amazing. I ordered Herb crusted salmon and steak Diane.
Great service and wonderful food. Very friendly and caring staff. Very pleased with our waiter, he made recommendations for a excellent dish.

We made reservations online for a Saturday night.  We were planning on having multiple parties to celebrate my daughters birthday.  The manager called Saturday afternoon to confirm the reservations and let us know that they would do the best they could to seat the parties close together using the max allowance per table due to Covid restrictions.  We were seated on time and the birthday party was seated in two tables across the aisle from one another. All of the food was great.  The servers handled  one bill for the multiple tables without problems (our server was Ashley).  We ordered a whole cheesecake which was delivered to my daughter with a birthday song.  All in all we were pleasantly surprised at how smoothly it all went especially on a Saturday night.

I stopped by for a quick afterwork meal with a friend I hadn&#39;t seen in a while. The atmosphere was buzzing as usual. The service was prompt so no complaints there. The meal was just okay. It seemed as if everything had been prepared the day before and warmed over. Considering that, I did have room for key lime cheesecake, which was delicious!
Service was great. Very cautious with Covid restrictions. Would definitely recommend. They are still offering the entire menu.

Decided to order takeout for Mother&#39;s Day and dine nearby overlooking the Hoover skyline.  The process to get your food was extremely poor. My husband went to check on our order 2 times and it couldn&#39;t be found. We finally received the promised (per the website) text that our order was ready about 1 hour AFTER the estimated ready time.. Our dinner, all 3 &#34;specialty meals&#34; were cold, not even slightly warm. In addition, the requested dining utensils were not provided, not even napkins. I want the tip back that I prepaid....The time with my family was precious, but CF needs to step up in every aspect.

Hi with my experience with this location it&#39;s horrible<br>James barret the &#34; Manager&#34; was such a rude to us<br>The let as waiting to our food 1 hour and 49 min <br>We just spoke with him we was so nice to him and he just left the Conversation and after this experience I am done with &#34;the Cheesecake Factory at all <br>I always feel that I need to take a day off to come here and eat , the waiting list so long and waiting for food it&#39;s more 1 hour so any way thank you

This place is always packed no matter what time you go. Went for brunch today which was great because you can order breakfast lunch and dinner if you like which is a plus. They have such a huge variety of food to choose from and the drink selection omg to die for. I got two cheesecake to go home but the cheesecake selection is unbelievable hint the word in the title of the restaurant. If you love variety and crowds then this is definitely the spot for you.

Ordered a French Country salad, a drink, and two cheesecake slices through DoorDash. The order arrived missing one cheesecake, an incorrect drink, and a bare salad. I called Cheesecake Factory and spoke with the manager, who told me the &#34;toppings were underneath the lettuce.&#34; There were maybe two pieces of cut up asparagus, hardly any cheese and no pecans as described. I asked her about the missing cheesecake and she told me to reorder through DoorDash, but said I&#39;d have to purchase a slice if I decided to come directly to the store instead. Extremely unsatisfied and will never order from here again.

So who new that The Cheesecake Factory (TCF) had an happy hour??  Don&#39;t answer because I&#39;ll be upset that you didn&#39;t share the information, so I&#39;ll spill the beans. There&#39;s a long list of happy hour items that are offered at a tremendous savings from their regular menu. Happy Hour is Monday-Friday 4pm to 6pm; regular hours Monday-Thursday 11am to 11pm; Friday 11am to 12:30am; Saturday 10am to 12:30am; Sunday 10am to 11pm; Saturday and Sunday brunch served from 10am to 2pm. <br><br>Other than the happy hour, TCF has great regular menu items to choose from. The food is simply delicious. My favorites are The Teriyaki Chicken with broccoli and brown rice, Spicy Cashew Chicken with brown rice, Chicken Riesling, Cobb Salad (sub chicken with salmon), tired yet...? I could go on and on about the food items here. Brunch is also a great option at TCF. Btw, I sat at the bar...

I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants at all, but have found myself here many a times for family events/celebration. This particular location is really popular and crowded as it should be, however the service is extremely lacking. Food is usually pretty consistent, although I would advise against ordering steak here as it seems they&#39;re unable to ever get it right. Servers here border on the line of being pretentious which always make for a nauseating dining experience. They probably only have a handful of decent waiters at best. My last experience dining here was a huge disappointment, more so than usual in regards to service. Based off of service alone, I wouldn&#39;t really bother here again to be honest. It&#39;s not like the food that serve is good enough to justify the terrible service.
Our favorite place to eat when in Birmingham! The Red Velvet Cheesecake never disappoints!

I really liked the Cheesecake Factory! We enjoyed our dinner here and I ordered the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp dish. It is a bit on the sweeter side but I&#39;m more of a sweet and sour type of person so I was okay with it! May not be for someone who does not like sweet food. The menu has SOOOO many options! I was so overwhelmed but I loved how diverse it was. Perfect for groups and families who are picky!
Great place to eat. You get your money&#39;s worth. Cheesecake is always good. Never disappointed with the service nor meals.

Food is always good. Host was a dingus. Waiter was great. Took my brother and mom to experience this for the first time. We were good little sheep with our face coverings and socially distant from any other party. Unfortunately that wasn&#39;t enough when showing them the display case of assorted cakes.  We were asked to exit to the outside area and wait in the rain.  Don&#39;t get me wrong, if there were signs or suggestions from staff on where to wait we would have followed the directions.  We weren&#39;t the only ones so our misery had an audience. There was a side waiting area that was fine, just not advertised or recommended.  But hey, we&#39;re all in this together, right?  Sure you betcha.

Cheesecake Factory was excellent.  Waitress was very friendly and provided great service.  We had salmon, Greek Salad and Brussel sprouts.  We would definitely go again and order the same.  Very pleased with the experience.   Unfortunately, we did not get the dessert.  It will be on our list on our next visit.
Always a wonderful time! I usually come to happy hour at least 2x a week. Half priced drinks and appetizers.. can&#39;t beat it. I also enjoy coming to Sunday Brunch it is a must try.

I have eaten at this quite a few times. It is one of my favorite restaurants. Unfortunately I do not go as often as I would like. The wait times can be torturous sometimes exceeding an hour on the weekends and holidays. So I often go on weeknights.<br>Of the current appetizers I have had The Sliders and the Pot Stickers. Both were good. The sliders were good because the meat was fresh and they prepared it the way I like it med rare. When you order med rare you know when the meat is freshly ground and not frozen. The Pot Stickers filling was tasty a nice blend of meat and spices.<br>My favorite salad is the Chinese Chicken Salad. I love the textural differences between crispy wonton and rice noodles and the lettuce green onions and the mandarin oranges. Top it off with their sweet plum dressing (I miss their Asian peanut dressing). I like to get my dressing on the side so I can control how much goes on it.<br>The main courses are varied and many. Pastas, hamburgers, steaks, chops, seafood, Skinnylicious(Lite fare), salads, CF specialties, and &#34;yes&#34; you can get eggs and omelettes.<br>The pastas are excellent just check them out. The pasta Neopoletano, Carbonara, Fettuccini Alfredo, and the list goes on and on. So many great pasta dishes. I&#39;ve had most of them and they have always been delicious and the portions are nice. I always save half especially if I plan on cheesecake.<br>The steaks and chops have always been fantastic and cooked to perfection. Usually I have the garlic mashed potatoes with a green veg such as asparagus, sauteed spinach, or broccoli. <br>I&#39;ll pass on the seafood. I just don&#39;t like it.<br>Now comes my favorite part, Dessert. I cant think of a better place for dessert.They have so many types of cheesecake. The cheesecakes are fantastic with over 32 at any given time you will find one you like. My favorites are the Ghiradelli Chocolate cheesecake, and the White chocolate Macadamia Nut.<br>If your not feeling cheesecake then they also have their specialty deserts. Linda&#39;s Rich Chocolate Cake ( you get a huge slice of cake with scoops of ice cream and whipped cream) If you want darker chocolate then the Black Out Cake is for you. They also serve an excellent apple walnut crisp with ice cream.

If you&#39;re indecisive, you may have some trouble with this menu! They have any and everything you could ever think of. With all of the choices in the world, I usually go for the Chipotle Chicken Pasta. Just the right amount of heat, creamy sauce, seasoned veggies and tortilla strips to top it off with a crunch. Ended with a slice of lemon meringue cheesecake that hit the spot.

Unfortunately, I did get sick from this chicken. The very next morning I had to go to Urgent Care. They ended up giving me three different prescriptions. I wasn&#39;t able to eat solid food for about four days. Beatrice, from the corporate office, called me about this incident. She was amazing! She was beyond nice and very apologetic about the Salmonella. She was also very concerned about my health and even offered to take care of my medical expenses. I really appreciate the follow up from the corporate office. This is definitely how you&#39;re supposed to take care of your customers.

I will never visit this location again.  The manager David was absolutely rude to me because I asked for an explanation of why I was given conflicting information regarding reservations for Christmas gatherings.  When I tried to ask a hostess who clearly told me they made reservations he told me not to talk to her and treated me like I was not a customer.   When I asked him to clarify their policy he said &#34;it just depends&#34;.  He got defensive because he couldn&#39;t answer what &#34;depended&#34;. Later as we waited I tried to make small talk with the hostess and explain that I wasn&#39;t upset with her but it just looked bad that one group the same size skipped us.  She understood but David came back over and told me not to talk to her as if I were a nuisance. Very disrespectful.  We felt unwelcome so we left.

Visited the Cheesecake Factory today. Food was good as always. Menu is still overwhelming lol. <br>I got the Chicken Bellagio, it was terrific. Followed that up with the lemon raspberry cheesecake, which Is my favorite. <br><br>On the down side, the service was terrible this trip. Bread was behind and took about 20-30 min after being seated. Food wait was almost 50min, we had no silverware for 10 minutes after getting our food, there was a waiter change in the middle of all that, and then they disappeared for 20 min when we were ready to leave. So it was a Long trip. It was weird too because we went a 4pm. <br><br>But I&#39;m not holding a grudge this time because the food made up for it.

This was probably one of the worst meals I&#39;ve ever had in a Cheesecake Factory. Waited over an hour to receive cold food. We ordered one of the combination and the stake was flavored pretty good but the salmon was cold and overcooked. Our server was sweet but overwhelmed with too many tables in her section to give decent service. The manager was kind but not solution oriented. <br><br>OAN: THE CHEESECAKE NEVER DISAPPOINTS!

I&#39;m here now treating my son&#39;s father to a Fathers Day meal. He got the back Grilled rib-eye steak medium rare, we had to send it back because the steak was very salty. Also I got the Paste Carbonara and it&#39;s horrible, the pasta wasn&#39;t cooked well enough (too hard). I really hate that I spent my hard earn money on this meal today. My son&#39;s sliders were awesome, hot and tender. At least he got to enjoy this meal.
Love this place the only thing that I don&#39;t like is the fact that this place does not take reservations during a holiday such as this.

Great cheesecake hands down delicious and would recommend for everyone.(wouldn&#39;t recommend Cookie dough) Although I came here for Chicken Taquitos and asked for no Onions to which I was Informed that they were premade for a fancy establishment who often prides themself  on the claim of being fresh this is absolutely unacceptable. I would personally only come here for cheesecake or pasta.

Our server, Ashley, helped us find what to order by asking what we wanted. She showed us the best choices for our wants. <br>The delivery times were spot on. Drinks were very fast, the entrees and dessert were each placed as previous item had been finished. <br>The dessert was a suggestion by Ashley. She said it was one of her favorites. It is now one of our favorites.<br>The check came promptly. Change was returned and we were off.<br>The restaurant was spotlessly clean in all areas of the lobby and dining area, the noise level was below most places. The restrooms were clean and well stocked. They even smelled nice. The area outside and the parking lot were also well kept.<br>The food was just too good. My fish and chips were too hot to eat. The fillets were meaty and thick. The batter outside just kind of slid apart. It was wonderfully paired with the unusual tarter sauce. (A wonderful surprise.) The chips and slaw were delicious too. <br>Ashley had the chicken salad sandwich. She smiled the whole time she ate it. She only finished half and loved the rest before bedtime. <br>We havent been loyal customers of TCF because it is hard for me to stand and wait.  We have learned that 3pm is the best for us. We will return soon.

Service was fantastic. Drinks were delicious and came out quickly. The food however was very salty. My husband and I both ordered the same dish but the appetizer was also super salty as well. The chocolate cherry cheesecake was by far the best flavor I&#39;ve ever tried in all my trips.
absolutely delicious! I ordered Avocado toast and I had the Eggplant Parmesan! They were both extremely flavorful and the service was a prompt and very nice!

Tried to place a to-go order for lunch and literally sat on the phone for 30min. By that time I did not want the food anymore and I took my business somewhere else. It&#39;s really frustrating and sad that somebody can&#39;t even answer the phone. They need better service.

If you have a Large group with lots of different tastes interest, this is the place for you! Their large menu cAn please everyone. We love comIng for birthdays and other special events so we can take cheesecake home for dessert.
We had an amazing anniversary dinner with my hubby! 20 years and counting. Service was exceptional

They have such a huge menu, but I always tend to order the pasta napoletana. It&#39;s sooooo yummy, and I always have leftovers! My friend and I came here on a Friday night around 7, and we were promptly seated, much to our surprise. I think it might be because it was raining outside. Our waiter, Ashley, was awesome! Super friendly and super helpful! I can always count on a nice dining experience at Cheesecake.

HORRIBLE!!!! If I could give 0 stars, I would. The service was a nightmare. After waiting over an hour to be seated. Nothing came out complete or timely. We had a party with 6 kids, who sat for over another hour without ever receiving their food. I never received my food either. Not only that, they took 45 minutes to turn on the heaters outside. The server packages the food to where it was all spilled and knocked over. I can&#39;t believe the poor service that this location offered. The manager made nothing but excuses for why we had to wait so long; when the other half off our neighboring party had not only eaten but had their food packed up from leftovers. I am utterly disgusted with everything about how this location handled everything.

The Cheesecake Factory has gReat food. I love their Hawaiian Salad. The only thing I do not like is there high prices. Because of the cost involved as a Middle Class Family, we can only choose to eat here on a birthday or anniversary, so no more than two times per year, or none for one or two years while eating at other places that has great food at a much more reasonable price.

If you want to pay $20 for some soggy and cold french fries, look no further! Due to covid, the only service currently offered is curbside pickup. When you place your order online you&#39;re given a time that your food should be ready. Be prepared to wait at least an hour longer than the time given to you for your food. I ordered the bacon burger with fries. When I opened the box, my fries were cold and soggy, and my burger was barley warm. Go to damn Burger King and get 10 bacon burgers for $20. If I could give no stars, I would.

I know..I know...it&#39;s JUST The Cheesecake Factory. Don&#39;t judge me. This review is solely on the exceptional service my friends &amp; I always experience during happy hour.<br><br>As fellow Yelpers have stated this is definitely a great place for happy hour. Great value on food. Decent cocktails &amp; beer. Wine selection could for sure offer more options...<br>But I won&#39;t bore you with unnecessary details. The reason we always seem to find ourselves at this chain restaurant is due to two wonderful bartenders. Cici &amp; James. <br><br>Very attentive &amp; usually can anticipate what you may need before you say it. They ensure that our orders are correct &amp; definitely know how to fix a decent drink.<br><br>So, I&#39;ll continue to be loyal...as long as they&#39;re around :) They deserve all of my business!

My passion fruit margarita that was served in a martini glass was delicious. It is now going to be one of my favorite drinks here. I ordered the Tex next eggrolls to eat and they were not as good as the last time I had them. They were a little salty and were a little bit too crispy. With so many menu options I am sure I will find something else to try next time.

Not the best service but food was amazing. Waiting at the to go counter makes you feel as though you&#39;re bothering the staff. The women preparing cheesecake never acknowledged the line of people waiting and the gentleman taking the orders continued his conversations despite the long line of hungry guest waiting to order. The hostess was also not the most pleasant and it was a very disappointing visit.

Yummy food, fun atmosphere, and a beautiful bar.  Unfortunately we did not take advantage of the bar (we were traveling through).  The place was booming but the staff was efficient and everything moved like a well oiled machine. <br><br>Incase you have not been here, the menu is large and everything is great.  Of course they are known for their dessert.

If you want to wait a long time for cold food this place is for you! Many people waiting at pickup had issues with their orders either missing items or cold. I really hope they take more pride in their customer service but time and time again they disappoint.

Suzy and I went there last nite. We sat at he bar area. We had a waitress tell us it is okay to eat there. She brought me a drink, and said that the wife&#39;s water was coming. She got bread, no plates, knives ,or forks. She say-&#34; I will be right back&#34; . Okay right back. <br>Then as many servers do, she stopped at every table to leave a check, take orders, remove plates.<br>At that point I got up and got my own utensils. No one noticed. When the waitress returned in a few minutes, I told her we were not happy with bad service, and were leaving. <br><br>It seems that the management could train better, or perhaps, hire more servers. They charge enough to pay them.<br> I guess I should know better than to go to a place with 100 items on the menu.<br> The management is NON- EXISTENT!

Never, ever again! I get we are all living a new normal, but today was off the charts poor service and communication. Two hours after placing my online order of a southwestern salad and two slices of cheese (one for my son, not both for me), I received a text that my order was ready. No where in the confirmation email was I told there would be a delay. The letter stated to go to the bakery counter upon arrival. Only when arriving on time were we told to park the car and wait for a text. An hour after that, we asked about our order. We were again told to go back to our car and wait for the text. We went home. The original order was placed at 1:45, we received THE TEXT at3:45. The text said to let them know when we got there. At 4:00 I told them I was there. At 4:15 I went inside to find my food. I got back into my car at 4:30. Three hours from when I placed my order, I was finally home with my food. Three hours! Most of the staff was nice, but there was one guy, I am assuming a manager, he didn&#39;t have a nametag on, was so short and sarcastic with me, I would have cancelled my order if I could have figured out how. The salad was awful, so much lettuce and so little of any other ingredients. The Red Velvet Cheesecake was devine as usual, thus the 3 stars. <br><br>I received a message from the company about my review. I want to note that I DID try to comment on the website first. It gave me a bunch of error messages. Must have been overloaded with complaints that day. It worked this morning.

Visited during the snowstorm of 2017. Had a super friendly waitress who provided great service and a few laughs.<br><br>I always seem to order the same thing, chicken and shrimp jambalaya with an extra side of sauce. This jambalaya differs because they use pasta instead of  traditional rice but it&#39;s delicious either way.<br><br>The entree is about $20, bit pricey but a very large portion that always leaves me with leftovers. <br><br>-----4/13/17<br><br>Visited for a quick slice of cheesecake. Nearly $9 for one slice of cheesecake. Although it is very tasty that the cost of an entree at other places.<br><br>Pleasant staff and large variety! A bit busy after 6pm during the week

I&#39;m pretty sure everyone and their mother has gone to a Cheesecake Factory at least one time. <br><br>Over the years, I&#39;ve noticed that the quality at this one has gone downhill. There have been tweaks to the menu, lower quality produce, and the food itself has gotten worse. Today, I got the white chicken chili, which I&#39;ve gotten before. It was not nearly as good as it had been before. The chili lacked depth in flavor, and the salsa did an okay job at complimenting it. I ended up adding tabasco to give it some lift. <br><br>As usual, the service was good. Also, the other dishes that my family ordered turned out much better than mine did. <br><br>*Side note: bring a light jacket if you&#39;re not a fan of the cold. Other customers were complaining about this, but I was fine.

This is your typical Cheesecake Factory. Always a consistently good meal. I do think that they&#39;ve gone up a dollar or two in their prices. I couldn&#39;t believe that I paid $30 for 2 mixed drinks, don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be doing that again!

Okay love this place and it has been awhile since I last visited. Today was the day and I wasn&#39;t alone. My mom treated me and it&#39;s also her fav place. She spent 30+ yrs in Brooklyn NY and has a healthy love affair with cheesecake ever since. However today&#39;s service and food was just horrible. Yes, the manager comp one of the three meals but I had to say something. The waitress left us after serving drinks which took over 20 minutes to receive even longer for bread even after I informed the waitress that my had surgery and had nothing to since the afternoon before. <br><br>The manger (she was the afternoon manager. The current one on duty at the time didn&#39;t bother to come by our table) in formed me the waitress had an emergency that caused her to leave. Someone sent a a waitress over to the table beside us but not ours. I had to flag a random waitress down just to get our food. We didn&#39;t get our food for almost an hour after. The manager instead of addressing the issue of no service simply chose to defend the food runners food time which, maybe true but the former waitress never put the order in. <br><br>I&#39;m just so disappointed and was my 73 year old mother who mostly will not return, well maybe just for the cheesecake via take out!

If you are a local to Birmingham, you have probably tried this place. I&#39;ve tried it a few times, but hadn&#39;t been back in about two years. My boss decided to bring us here for our Christmas Eve lunch. <br>Surprisingly the restaurant was not very busy, but the service was still very slow. Our server was very friendly, but she wasn&#39;t very attentive, especially seeing how they weren&#39;t very busy. To start we ordered the avocado rolls and calamari, which took a long time to get, when we finally did get them, we found a very long hair in the calamari. My boss was especially upset about that. We sent it back and our server said she would get some fresh calamari out to us as soon as possible. The avocado rolls were delicious, I had the Santa Fe Salad and my boss had steak, which were both delicious. Our calamari never made it back to our table though. As a matter of fact, after our food was delivered, we were only checked on once. Then the bill came and we noticed we were still charged for the calamari. Needless to say, it was not a great visit. I doubt we will be back any time soon.

This place is always super busy but the food was always pretty good and even with it being hard to get into and find a seat and get waited on, we still went from time to time and it was always a good experience. <br>This time it was a week day afternoon and we were in the area and decided to stop by and get a quick bite to eat. We did this because it wasn&#39;t busy. <br>This was a terrible mistake!<br>We ordered a glass of wine, entree and dessert with coffee. We received the dessert first, the glass of wine came later and was warm after sitting on the bar for sometime. <br>I had to ask the waiter why dessert came before the entree and he indignantly told me that is how it was and got the manager who apologized for all of the confusion. After that the manager finally brought the entree. I had to ask for the coffee which finally came after everything else. <br>The waiter was a young man. I don&#39;t blame him for any of this, he obviously was not trained properly and wasn&#39;t even aware of the havoc he caused. I think at the end of all of this he probably thinks I was just a grumpy old white man that didn&#39;t much care for him. What a terrible experience and I never want to go back again. <br>The manager did comp the food but charged us for a glass of wine which  was $14. We left a $20 bill on the table and left. The people that manage this place should know better and do better. <br>I&#39;m done with them. After all of this I feel sick to my stomach.

The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to treat yourself or guests from out of town.  We took our granddaughter to lunch today.<br><br>We were promptly seated and our waiter Dave appeared moments later.  He brought our drinks and bread with butter, a little extra you don&#39;t want to miss.<br><br>Our granddaughter ordered the orange chicken and pronounced it very good.  My wife and I shared crab cake bites, stuffed mushrooms and a great little salad from the light and small plate menu.  <br><br>Of course we ordered cheese cake, one for our granddaughter and one to share. It was excellent.  It is not inexpensive, but good quality food and excellent service.

My experiences here have ranged from high to low. I&#39;ve had their pastas, Chinese dishes, and even one of their popular dishes, Chicken Madeira. I feel like the quality has consistently been going down for me. Wait times feel like they have increased (30 minutes this past visit), the food portions seem to have decreased, and the food comes out cold even after 30 minutes of waiting. <br><br>Besides their entrees, the cheesecake is still delicious! I ordered a strawberry cheesecake that did its purpose and got that cheesecake craving out of the way. I would&#39;ve enjoyed it better had I not been hangry for a long part of the meal.<br><br>I want to give this place a higher rating because it was one of my first favorites in Birmingham, but they seriously need to change the way they run things to warrant an upgrade.

I fail to understand what the big fuss is about.<br>Yes, they have a diverse menu, but the food, for me has just been ok.<br><br>I ordered the avocado toast and requested egg on top--it was ok. Avocado egg rolls I thought a little soggy.<br><br>I came for my birthday, and unfortunately they were out of the dessert I wanted.<br>I opted instead for strawberry shortcake instead, which was ok, but the shortcake itself was rather disappointing and tough in texture.<br><br>I will say they decorated the dessert really nice for my birthday--that was sweet.<br>Would probably not return.

First off our server was amazing so this has nothing to do with customer service. My friend and I come here many times for the happy hour and we usually always get the same things: Buffalo blast and nachos. We have always had a great experience until today. <br>First buffalo blast: there was more gooey dough then there was chicken. But we dealt with it and just picked off the dough and ate the chicken   <br>Now the nachos: the first platter we got the chips were great, but the shredded cheese was all clumped in the middle and barley melted. So we asked for another one. <br>The second platter - half the chips were burnt black and the other half were undercooked and the chips when bitten were &#34;pulley&#34; they didn&#39;t break like normal chips. And guess what. This time there was one a little shredded cheese on about three chips. Thankfully the manager had no issues with taking that off our bill. However the quality has declined quite a bit, and my friend and i are currently looking for a new happy hour spot.

Cheesecake Factory may be a chain restaurant, but I love it. They have a large selection of foods from all kinds of different cuisines. So it&#39;s a great place to go if a group of people cannot deicide which cuisine to go with. I love all their pasta dishes, but this time I chose to try the chicken  reisling. It was very good. The sauce was nice and creamy. The portion was enough to be two meals for me. I didn&#39;t even have enough room for dessert. Great place!

So I&#39;ve visited this place several times and it&#39;s always just so so and this visit was probably the worst visit ever besides the cheesecake it&#39;s always great. <br><br>I started with the Egg Roll sampler which included the Avocado, cheeseburger, Southwest and chicken taquito and The avocado and southwest was super good but the other 2 not so much. <br><br>For our entree we tried the Bang Bang Chicken and shrimp.  I was totally against this dish and any other dish from here because I&#39;ve never had a great entree at this place but we both agreed<br>to share the $20 dollar plate of goulash. We were informed before we ordered that if we didn&#39;t like coconut or curry that we wouldn&#39;t like this and both of us love coconut and curry and this just taste like something very very weird. <br> <br>Now for the best part of the visit I had the Lemon raspberry cream cheesecake and I absolutely love it. It&#39;s my favorite one because I just love the raspberry purée and the cake and the lemon cheesecake it&#39;s all just so divine. <br> <br>I probably will just go in and pick up some cheesecake next time and save myself 50 bucks. Hey

It&#39;s it touristy, cheesy, a mall attraction, with a wait that takes forever? Yes it is all of that. I know that many of us try hard to avoid the typical chain restaurants that anchor a mall. Many people just walk in, order a slice of cheesecake to go and that was their experience. We&#39;ve been known to do that as well. However, we really do like their food. This is one place where the menu literally has something for everyone in the family, and given the size of the menu, it should! I usually can&#39;t get past the appetizers and a salad to create my meal since there are so many good things to choose from. I just have to be disciplined when I order. If I order an entree, then no appetizer as everything here is a massive portion. So my daughter and I usually share especially when we go here. We always order their avocado rolls which are amazing with thick chunks of avocado and vegetables wrapped in an egg roll wrapper and fried. We also ordered their Thai chicken wraps. This platter took up the majority of the table because it is so big. Bibb lettuce with chicken satay, cold noodles, pickled onions and cucumber and shredded carrots to top off your wrap and your choice of three sauces. Delicious. My husband ordered the crab bites which were very good and weren&#39;t crammed with filler. I&#39;m still not sure why, but we ordered an Asian chicken salad and it was really good. Everything on the salad was fresh and crisp and the chicken was steaming hot. Add three different flavors of cheesecake and we were deep into a food coma. So much food for only 3 people. <br>We have yet to have a bad meal here. They are always consistent and the food is always good and a great value for the size of the portions. This is always a safe bet when you aren&#39;t sure of what you want- Asian, Italian, Tex-mex, salads, a sandwich, great appetizers, you can&#39;t go wrong.

I think it is really passe to hate on The Cheesecake Factory.  It&#39;s easy to ridicule the oafish masses who will wait in a line that stretches out the door for the chance to throw down $20 for a plate of fettuccine alfredo and wash it down with a 200-calorie strawberry lemonade (free refills!). <br><br>But there is something charming and &#34;just-feels-right&#34; about sitting at the bar and enjoying a large draft beer (or hell, even a Long Island Iced Tea during happy hour) and relaxing for a bit.  The bartenders at this location are chipper, enthusiastic, and seem happy to be there - which you should be, too.<br><br>I recommend skipping the Glamburger and everything else in that &#34;War and Peace&#34;-sized tome of a menu, but you can do far worse than grabbing a stool with someone special and having a Blue Moon and sharing a slice of that Tiramisu Cheesecake.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is so massive, so gratuitously decorated, and so over-the-top, that when you&#39;re here, everything seems right with the world.

I don&#39;t get the low scores on here.  There is a reason there is like an hour or more wait every time I come here.  I have always gotten great service and superior treatment by all of the staff on every visit I have had. <br><br>I don&#39;t come here often so I get the same thing every time I eat here.  I love the fried mac and cheese. I have had it at several other places and only one place has even come close. Every component of this dish is well done and they come together exactly as I would want it.  For my entree I get the Louisiana chicken pasta with extra sauce. Love it every time and left overs heat up to my liking too. I love dipping up that creamy sauce with bread.   My wife and I usually split a slice of cheesecake.  She likes it plain and I like it funky.  So, how do we split one?  Vanilla bean cheesecake with extra whip cream and a side of raspberry sauce. Those additions are just enough to make it dressed up for me while the simple straight up vanilla bean is just what my wife likes. <br><br>I always have a good experience here and I know I will return.

This place is the bomb! They have a never ending menu with options for everyone, they serve double portions so you&#39;ll most likely be taking home enough for another meal. Save room for dessert! My go to dish is called Louisiana Chicken Pasta, try it! In all my years going here I&#39;ve only had 2 bad experiences where one time the floor was too slippery to walk across &amp; another time where I felt rushed by a waiter to leave because he was wanting to turn the table over for new customers.

I absolutely loved this place. So did what looked like everyone in Birmingham. It was packed, but with great reason, the food was to die for. The service was excellent and when you taste the cheese cake you feel like you&#39;ve died and gone to heaven. Can&#39;t wait to go bakc

Great FFF, consistently  satisfying. Service is good but could improve. I love the salmon with lemoN butter sauce, mashed potatoes, and asparagus! Go with the basic cheesecake with strawberries. Much better than the extravagant offerings.

I remember how I visited Cheesecake Factory for first time in my life 8 years ago during my first trip to Bellevue, WA. Restaurant was dark with ambient lights around the columns, there was a huge showcase with dozens of cheesecakes, waiters have been literally running all the time, and restaurant was full with clients. I&#39;ve ordered lunch version of Pasta da Vinci and was really impressed.<br><br>Now, back to the latest visit. Yes, it was a different restaurant in a different city and state, but it is still the same restaurant chain with the same menu, so I can&#39;t stop comparing it to my first experience.<br><br>Restaurant was half empty, yet we weren&#39;t allowed to seat were we wanted. We wanted to get smaller lunch portions, but they told us that they don&#39;t serve lunch sizes in the evening anymore, so we had to order full-size dishes. I&#39;ve chosen the same pasta da Vinci and stuffed mushrooms to share, my wife ordered a sandwich (don&#39;t remember which one), and daughter got cheese pizza.<br><br>Surprisingly, that pizza was the best thing on the table. Mushrooms were almost tasteless. Not sure what they have done to them, but it felt like I&#39;m chewing a rubber. Sandwich was on the level of an average fast food on a gas station, but most disappointing was my pasta. Undercooked (no, it wasn&#39;t al dente, it was really undercooked), with less than expected ingredients and weird taste. When I asked a waiter to put some cheese on it, he grated it with such enthusiasm so some of that cheese ended up on my pants and jacket. We also got couple of milkshakes afterwards, they were on a par with any fast food around.<br><br>This is one of the worst experiences I ever had in a place that calls itself &#34;restaurant&#34;.

First time to eat here,was delicious I had the shrimp with asparagus and angel hair pasta,it was so yummy,then had the chocolate cheesecake the 30th anniversary special,was the most wonderful cheesecake I have ever had,and our waiter was wonderful,will definitely return
As always we love this place. I can not say anything bad from the service to the food. We make several trips a year to this place. :)

Had a late dinner with my husband tonight. Our waiter Paul was the best waiter that I have ever had there. Austin thinks that he is the best waiter here but he can&#39;t hold a candle to Paul. I had the Shrimp Scampi &amp; Steak Diane Sautéed Shrimp with Whole Cloves of Garlic, White Wine, Fresh Basil and Tomato and Medallions of Certified Angus Beef Steak Covered with Black Peppercorns and a Rich Mushroom Wine Sauce served with Mashed Potatoes (a little cold).  My shrimp was not cook properly, therefore, Paul informed the manager and she got it taken care. <br><br>My husband had the Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken which is a Half Chicken Served with Mashed Potatoes, Carrots and Watercress. Topped with a Light Lemon Garlic-Herb Sauce. <br><br>Upon the next visit we will request to be seated wherever Paul is serving. He checked on us often and was very pleasant. He reminded me of how the servants were in Downton Abbey he was some how always there but, never in the way.<br><br>When we received our bill we were surprised that the manager gave a complimentary strawberry cheesecake.

Excellent. Food was very good and plentiful. I had the Louisiana chicken,   <br> my wife had the pasta carbonara, my granddaughter had the fettuccine alfredo, my daughter had Renee&#39;s special.<br><br>Everyone was very pleased. The service was also excellent.
The best place to have the best meal, can&#39;t get enough, I really enjoyed their hamburgers and their chocolate tuxedo cheesecake.

I placed an online order and when I arrived to pick it up, the girl at the counter was quite unfriendly. Once I paid and got my order, no sooner than I got to the car and realized I forgot my beverage. When I went back in, the girl at the counter argued about it not being on my order so, I offered to pull it up on my phone. She ended up going to get my beverage, but returned with a cup that was just over half full. At this point, I&#39;m completely frustrated and no longer wanted to debate with her so I left. This place is either a hit or miss, it&#39;s different every time and this visit was definitely a miss. I can recommend it because the food is usually pretty good, but the service is not that great.

I had never been to the cheesecake factory before. The restrooms were DISGUSTING! My coworker and I went for dinner at 5:30<br>. We didn&#39;t leave until 8:30 because the service was so slow. Our server didn&#39;t even greet us for a solid 10 mins after being sat. He forgot silverware multiple times. When I ordered a steak he didn&#39;t bring a knife and they dropped my food off and it took another 5 mins to bring my coworkers chicken mediera. When he got it was cold and had been sitting... just sad service! The only good thing was the cheesecake...

I come to this Cheesecake Factory everytime I am in Birmingham for work; about once a year.  Its on par with all other Cheesecake Factories I have visited, consistently good.  I like to have the spicy cashew chicken, which is tasty and huge.  I wouldnt describe it has overly spicy.  Here are some take aways:<br><br>-Penny doesnt work here (she wouldnt be able to keep up with the pace at this resturant anyhow).<br>-Usually there is a wait.  I tend to come early to avoid the crowds.<br>-Parking is crazy busy in this shopping district.  I perfer to Uber to avoid it.<br>-It tends to be noisy due to lots of people and high ceilings.<br>-A lot of the tables share a common back bench, so don&#39;t expect a private booth.  Not a problem if you a comfortable around people, but can be awkward if you are shy or smell funny.<br>-Price point is on par for the amount of food you get and the quality of the restaurant.<br>-Has outside seating available, but I have never used it.  Alabama has crazy rain storms, so I prefer not to take my chances.<br>-If you have never been to a Cheesecake Factory, prepare yourself for a huge menu.  I love have so many options and I tend to check Yelp for ideas on what I should order.  Or I see the awesome stuff coming to other tables and just order that.

Every time I come to Birmingham, I always get tot he Cheesecake Factory.  The service and food are always on point. I&#39;ve never had to wait long and even this weekend with a huge softball tournament going on they are seating people quickly. <br><br>Dinner or dessert only it&#39;s always a great place and fantastic food.  You gotta try it if you haven&#39;t !

Didn&#39;t even make it past the entryway. <br>First of all the attitude of the greater sucked. I&#39;m not even sure what you call the man behind the counter. Not a friendly face at all. I informed him that we needed a table for three plus two babies and it was all over his face that I was an inconvenience. Of course he hands me a buzzer and tells me 20 to 30 minute wait. Mind you there were open tables. Interesting! While waiting and deciding if we were even going to stay we heard a waiter or maybe bus boy spouting off at the mouth saying &#34;I&#39;m grown I ain&#39;t gotta take that&#34; blah blah blah attitude. I don&#39;t know what is wrong with thier staff. We purchased a cheesecake to go at $30 only because it was for our 12 year old sons birthday. This is a chain restaurant with bad staff. Thier prices are high. The best best is to get your cake and go some where else for food.  It felt old in there too.

The Cheesecake Factory is conveniently located at The Summit on 280. It&#39;s a great place to stop by and grab a bite while you&#39;re shopping (not on weekends... it&#39;s usually a 45 min wait or longer). I&#39;ve always had a positive experience at this location, so my mom and I decided to enjoy a late lunch here. The spinach dip was watery and not good at all. I would not recommend it. I ordered the Asian lettuce wraps and they were quite delicious! The chicken was slightly overcooked, but the freshness of the veggies made up for that. My mother had the chicken bellagio. She substituted angel hair pasta instead of the pasta it came with for no extra charge. We finished our afternoon with a slice of Reese&#39;s and Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake. Both were great!

This restaurant has the worst service.These idiots made me and my family and friends wait 1 hour and 35 mins when they told us 1 hour 15.This servive is trash.I hate this place.Dont go if u come with large group.These people are trash.Dont go here.These people need Jesus in there life.They have big mouths and there hairlines arent straight.Thats a no no.But anyways service is trash and sucks butt.DONT GO TO THIS TRASH PLAC.TRASH SERVICE

Food, good. Service, good. Prices, a little high. I would not recommend this restaurant for seniors especially with ambulatory problems. There are only three handicap parking spaces, yet there are four take-out spaces near to the front door and four regular spaces between the take-out spaces and the front door. I counted 6 seniors with walking canes inside the restaurant.
Chain restaurant with huge selection of food. Good part I guess is almost anyone can find something to eat here. Bad part is they don&#39;t do anything very well. Only eat here for cheesecake.

Met my mother here for dinner today.  We waited about 10 minutes to be seated. We started off with the Eggroll Sampler for our appetizer. The sampler comes with halves of Cuban egg roll (my favorite), Tex Mex egg roll, Avocado egg roll and Firecracker Salmon egg roll. Each roll is served with an accompanying sauce.  <br><br>My mom ordered the Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo and I ordered the Tuscan Chicken (located in the Skinnylicious menu). I tried to lessen the caloric damage between the fried eggrolls and the highly anticipated cheesecake. Lol. The gumbo was amazing! I like that you can choose between white and brown rice. The dish had a great taste to it and the pieces of sausage gave it the perfect kick. <br><br>The Tuscan Chicken has a variety of flavors. Very light tasting and easy on the calories. The chicken was a tad bit tough. My only major gripe about this dish is the balsamic vinaigrette is very pungent and overpowers the dish. I only tasted the balsamic in the tomatoes, which came in abundance, so I don&#39;t know if they are marinated in the vinaigrette prior or what but I&#39;m pretty sure my mouth puckered with every bite. Other than that the dish served its Mediterranean purpose (fresh basil, capers, farro, artichokes and etc) and it is definitely a fulfilling meal considering it&#39;s less than 600 calories. <br><br>Overall, we had a nice, pleasant dining experience. Our server&#39;s name was John and he was awesome!

Terrible. Terrible, unorganized and a chaotic mess. My husband and I won&#39;t be eating here again. We ordered online thinking we could skip the usual ridiculous dinner rush. Wrong! We waited in line for over 30 minutes just to get to the counter where one girl, Kaitlyn, was running two registers by herself. When we finally were able to ask about our food, which had been sitting on the counter getting cold, there was no apology given and no kind of concern was shown. Our food was cold and no kind of compensation was offered. We left without taking our food which would have been cold and soggy. We were quite upset, mainly over wasting our time and the lack of customer service. If I could give it a negative star I would.

Service - great loved my waitress <br>Food - great, chicken was wonderful, and cooked great, banana cheesecake.<br>Complains- men&#39;s bathroom (for a place that has over 100 ppl in it, and only has 3 useable stalls)<br>*up rated, due to them willing to listen to my review.

So when it took an hour to get food<br>I was ok with that <br>When there were 5 minutes between plates coming out<br>I was ok with that<br>When spaghetti was served cold<br>I was not ok with that<br>When the chicken was tough dry with cold brown rice<br>I was not good with that<br>When the avocado turkey sandwich had no avocado <br>I was not good with that <br>When the on duty manager (patrica) came over to<br>Explain that the reasons for the above was <br>1 because we did not know how to order <br>2 that a window in the kitchen was open and that cooled the food down<br>3 it was the kitchen &#39;s fault<br>That was when  I knew that not only was the kitchen being run by idiots but that. The Cheesecake Factory recruits their managers from<br>Closed gas stations<br><br>So even a good gas station manager would offer to clean your windshield if they put water in your gas tank.  Pathica missed that day in managers school so for all our troubles we were told that she felt sure our next meal their would be better <br><br>They are living on their name not their food
In adequate parking, extremely long wait and slow service. Located on most congested part of summit.

Very slow service! Came in with just one other person and it took us nearly 15 minutes to get water AFTER we were seated. Then we both ordered very simple cheesecakes and those took another 15 mins to come out. Server was very inattentive. AMAAAZZZIINNNGGGG Cheesecake like always. I&#39;ve always loved this location, but it seems like the service is going down.

On the day before school starts, I always take my daughters out to lunch and to an afternoon movie.  Yesterday, no one could agree where to eat and I chose the Cheesecake Factory because there was something for everyone. <br><br>I had avocado toast (from the &#34;Superfood&#34; menu) and the Samosas from the &#34;Small Plate&#34; menu.  The trick, I think, with avocados is to be generous with seasonings, as they have such a mild flavor.  Sadly, CF didn&#39;t really focus on seasoning, or texture.  The plate looked beautiful, with cherry tomatoes cut in half over the green mashed avocado, and artfully-placed radishes sprinkled over the concoction.  The toast underneath, however, was too thick and tough for an easy bite and the load of avocado mash on top tumbled off with each bite.  The Samosas were pretty nondescript - small and quite oily, with a strong curry powder flavor.<br><br>Two of my daughters got burgers which were delicious - and fries that were the best.  We took home one entire burger.  My other daughter got the cup of homemade mushroom soup and the da Vinci pasta, both of which were good, if perhaps a bit over-salted.<br><br>The tab came to almost $75, and with tip was $90.  Quite an expensive for a very average experience.

The ambience alone will keep me coming back. Its always quite a treat to eat here, even if it&#39;s just for drinks or dessert. Depending on what you order here, you can rack up quite a bill, so plan accordingly.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried quite a few dishes here over the years. From the Romano crusted chicken, to the Four Cheese Pasta , to an appetizer called Buffalo Blasts, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal. Not spectacular either, but always good. Portion sizes often lead to to-go boxes. The servers are very knowledgeable about the menu and are ready to recommend a dish, appetizer or dessert at your request. The bar staff really know how to mix a great drink, especially for a not-so-frequent drinker like myself. <br><br>If you&#39;ve never been here, you should go. Treat yourself every once in awhile. You deserve it!

This was the worst experience here I have ever had. We ordered tuna app - tuna had tints of grey ( which to me seems like it&#39;s old) They tried to cover it with an excessive amount of sauce. <br><br>My girlfriend ordered loaded potato bites and there were crab bites in it! Pray you don&#39;t have shellfish allergies... <br>I ordered lemon herb roasted chicken, which used to be a half chicken with bones.
