I got what looked like half a chicken run over by a truck with no bones. <br>the manager did address our concerns and comped basically 60% of our tab in all fairness, but that isn&#39;t the expectation for anyone going out to eat. <br><br>This place has gone downhill substantially, and I wouldn&#39;t recommend anyone go there.

Really good food. Great ambiance. Grilled pork chops and apple sauce are my favorite their. But they the whole menu is loaded with good things to eat. Oh yeah do I need to mention they have a separate menu with nothing but cheesecakes I&#39;ve never made it to the end.

I decided to take my family out for dinner and this is where they wanted to go. Our wait wasn&#39;t long. We arrived around 2pm and enjoyed the outside sitting area. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive to all 9 of us at the table. We started with the chicken dumplings and they were crispy on the outside and tender and full of flavor on the inside. The Asian sauce that paired with them put them over the top. We had a lot of different entres but the chicken madeira was the choice of half of our table. I tasted it and it was delicious. I ordered the shrimp scampi and added a little alfredo sauce and it was the best dish on the table. It paired very well with the wine sauce. <br>Of course we all had various pieces of cheesecake for the finishing dish. We were all pleased and will be back.

Four stars. Our waitress was great but the pasta was a little al dente for my taste. I ordered the pasta carbonara with chicken. We also had Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta (really good!) with chicken as well.<br><br>My favorite app is the Buffalo Blast! It&#39;s fried Buffalo chicken dip . It&#39;s like it can straight from heaven and wham you are hooked! <br>They have a huuuuggggeee menu! The great thing about this place is they have food for everyone. <br>Cheesecake....  cheesecake... all the cheesecake.. glorious and you can just skip the food and head straight for dessert. My favorite is the peanut butter or the red velvet. <br>They also have divine chocolate cheesecake options. Just go ahead and order a coffee with some baileys and relax in cheesecake heaven

Well we got there right at 11 ( not crowded yet)<br>It took 45 min to get a lunch size salad <br>We waited and waited<br>Asked waiter twice<br>On second request after eating 3 loaves of bread<br>She stated &#34; the kitchen just started them - should be out soon&#34;<br>Really? How long does small salad take when your not crowded at 11am ????<br>When they finally came out at 1150<br>the waitress said we could talk w a manager and we said yes we want to but never brought him to our table <br>Just gave us the check <br>No manager was even present <br><br>We expect more <br>It&#39;s a sala<br>So I follow there response which was no help they should be calling me not me chasing them

I placed an online order for curbside pickup to be ready by 2:06pm. I called the number when I arrived as instructed and waited several rings before someone answered and then waited 10 minutes for my order to come out. When the girl brought it she asked my name and what I ordered. it was now 2:26pm. Then told me she brought the wrong order. So she came back a few minutes later....and my food was cold and I wasn&#39;t given any utensils. <br>I would&#39;ve gone inside to fix it but I needed to get back on the road for a 3 hour drive. I just wanted a nice meal. But I wasn&#39;t in the mood to be held up any longer. And for the price this shouldn&#39;t have happened. <br>If you can&#39;t handle curbside on a busy day the don&#39;t offer it. <br>Definitely not worth the $17.

Our meal was great no issues at all. Even getting a high top at the bar on a busy Sunday night was easy. My issue is THAT THEY RAN OUT OF ICE CREAM!!!! How is this possible? They have a whole page dedicated to ice cream.... WTF?

Went to the Cheesecake Factory this evening, waited 20 minutes before someone took our drink order, (not even our waiter), finally got our drink, appetizer and some bread.  About an hour and 10 minutes later, inquired about our meal, which was 2 chicken salad sandwiches and again waited 15 minutes more.  Finally, told our server, forget the food and to bring our check.  About 10 minutes later, she shows up with our food, we told her we didn&#39;t want it and to bring our check.  Pretty pathetic for the Cheesecake Factory.  This appears to be a poor management issue.

Its cheese cake factory... If you can&#39;t find something to eat on their 15 page menu (exaggeration) then your not hungry. Cheesecake factory isn&#39;t in my top 5 places to eat in Vegas. Its a ok fall back. I always find the restaurant very loud , I enjoy being able to hear the person talking across the table from me. The food is ok nothing to write home about. The cheesecake is good of course but most pieces will run you $9.00 each. The restaurant is in a very nice shopping area , great place to take a leisurely walk off those cheesecake calories.

Went for a birthday dinner. The wait was long but expected. Once we were seated the real wait began. We waited for drinks, we waited to order , we waited on food and then we waited on cheesecake!  I will not go back. Bad service does not equate to good reviews. No communication from the staff, no explanation... only as we waited for cheesecake which we ordered so we could go home early- then we were told the bakery was behind

We&#39;ve been here a few times and it was pretty good this time it wasn&#39;t all that great.  I got the spicy Shanghai Noodle which were good, but the wife got a honey Truffle chicken that didn&#39;t taste a thing like honey. The truffle sauce tasted just like mineral oil.  We had three other people in our group that ordered the chicken and had the same experience.  Will not be ordering that again...but the cheese cake was good as always

I think this is the smallest Cheesecake Factory that I&#39;ve been to.  Such being the case, this place is packed to the brim (at least on Saturdays), so beware and plan accordingly. <br><br>No reservations. <br>Happy hour is M-F 4-6. $5 for a good variety of favorite appetizers (they&#39;re the full size), and $5 for draft? And a good price for specific mixed drinks too. <br>Bathrooms are clean! <br>Food comes out quickly. <br>They offer complimentary valet for patrons, so you don&#39;t go driving in that huge lots for 20 mins!

Today the service was so slow we couldn&#39;t get refills. I ordered a cup of coffee and 20 mins later I got it this was long after we had finished our meal and was waiting on cheesecake to go. I was never offered a refill on coffee. My friend and I were talking so we were not really demanding. I did say to the waiter you need some help don&#39;t you? He said oh no. The table next to us never got several things they ask for. The food was good but it is hard to overcome poor service. My two cheesecakes that I took home were not very good. The salted caramel tasted old for lack of a better word. This was my second trip and I don&#39;t see a reason for a third.

This is one of my favorite happy hour spots. The tex-mex egg rolls are bomb! The facility is nice, the wait staff is always kind and attentive.  Their brunch is really good. Hands down the best French toast ever. My husband likes the pot pie dish.. can&#39;t reall the name. The kale salad is really good.

This is my go to place when I&#39;m indecisive about what to eat, but still want good food and/or dessert. Very diverse and delicious menu with even better dessert! Very nice staff and wonderful atmosphere. LOVE!!!!

Good experience. Standard Cheesecake Factory experience except you will wait 30-1hr to be seated if you go during dinner. Other than that the experience is the same as it is at any other Cheesecake Factory. Staff is courteous and helpful. Huge variety of entrees as you would expect. I got the shepherds pie this time and was pleasantly surprised. Huge portion. Mash potatoes layered on top of the ground beef stew. Tasty and savory. Good for families. Hazelnut cheesecake was delicious.

Sarah K. waited on my family of 6 this past Saturday. She did an excellent job!! We never once had to ask for refills as she kept our glasses full! Her knowledge of the menu was very impressive considering she mentioned she was a newer server! I would definitely request to sit in her section the next time I dine here!!

Although the menu can be overwhelming, the food is always on point. There are a few items that are consistently sold out (samosas) but I guess that speaks to how good they are. Wait staff is friendly and professional.

I am very disappointed in the meal I had at Cheesecake Factory. I ordered the Chicken Riesling. When my order was brought out it was the Chicken Picante instead. I said no I said Chicken Riesling. Ok so they remade it I guess and brought out what was suppose to be the correct order. First off I would like to say the noodles seem like frozen noodles based on the consistency. I looked over the ingredients of this dish and viewed pictures online and it looked delish. I tried to like it but the more I think about it the more upset I get. Frozen noodles, the bacon tasted and looked like bacos. It&#39;s suppose to have onion in it but didn&#39;t taste like it, and I didn&#39;t see any maybe just onion powder? I wish I&#39;d sent it back. I&#39;m trying to like Cheese Cake Factory like I used to but all the dishes I order are just so bland. My daughters kids spaghetti wasn&#39;t any better.

Sooooooo YALLLL! I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory, HOWEVER... <br><br>Our host was fucking rude as shit when we inquired about our wait time because we had been waiting 15 minutes longer than our expected wait time. When he sat us down he smirked at us and smacked the table with our menus and said &#34;this table&#34;,<br>then came back to the table when he noticed my best friend moving some silverware on the table and a plate out of her way and said &#34;do I need to take your silverware away?&#34; As if we were about to harm someone with them. Please take note WE HAD NOT EVEN RECEIVED ANY FOOD YET. We clearly need the silverware. Then he turned to run off, and overheard me say that the wait time was poorly executed, and then turned back around to say, &#34;I hope you notice you came to the Cheesecake Factory, one of the most popular restaurants in Birmingham, and so wait times can be long. I said &#34;well,&#34; and gestured my hand across the outdoor patio which is almost completely empty. He then says well the outdoor area &#34;has to be set up due to not having a waitress in specific areas&#34; even though there were already 3 tables with customers and a waitress already outside. He went-on and on about how it wasn&#39;t his fault and then leaned down to the table and said &#34; now let&#39;s wrap up this theatre drama and pack it back up&#34; <br><br>To which i responded,&#34; no theatre is awesome,&#34; <br><br>&#34;Uh calm down thespian&#34; he replied<br><br>Now our waitress was EXTREMELY quick and very knowledgeable of the menu items and what they still had available. She was very kind and the food is always delicious! She provided GREAT customer service, something that host clearly needs some more training on. <br><br>(EDIT): our server told us there was a huge party outside before we were seated bc of Florida evacuees, so the wait time was explained, but our host still should have updated us.

I went today to the Cheesecake Factory for the first time and was very pleased! Our server was incredible and our meals were just as good! I got the Lemon-Basil shrimp and it was fantastic along with the low carb cheesecake with strawberries!

Food was, as always, PERFECT! Never had an issue here! Great service, however I got the vibe that the waitress was trying to rush us out of the restaurant and boxed our cheesecakes when we exclaimed we wanted them right after our meal. Went on a Sunday around 3pm so I&#39;m not sure what the rush was! Waitress was super sweet however. Of course will return

My finance and I came to indulge in some desert after a lovely dinner at a nearby establishment. We arrived quite late but the cheese cake factory was still popping. We took a seat at the bar and were immediately greeted and provided a menu as request for some desert.<br><br>Holey moley there are a lot of delicious options to choose from. My weakness for Carmel won and we ended up with a Carmel deluxe number. It was delicious just don&#39;t look at the calorie count and enjoy the gluttony. <br><br>The only disappointing thing was the lack of alcoholic desert drinks. The only option was add liquor to coffee which was alright but I would have thought there was something more. <br><br>Overall great place to satisfy that sweet tooth. <br><br>Till next time

the food is mediocre &amp; the service was awful. we had a party of 10 &amp; it took 45 minutes just to get our drinks. one waitress was very helpful but the other had an awful attitude. very disappointed &amp; probably will not be back

I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and we were treated very kind, love this place! She also lives in the summit appartments and we order from here often, the wait is never long as far as pickup orders! We will continue to order from here for as long as she lives close by!

Since they don&#39;t always take reservations, you may have to prepare for a wait that could last up to an hour. The food is flavorful, savory, and most importantly- delicious! I honestly felt that the quality (and quantity) of food lived up to the price paid. On the down side, they&#39;re tremendously busy, so you may be there waiting for awhile. So far, all the entrees Ive had lived up to the expectations I have set for this establishment. The cheesecake is absolutely phenomenal! Wish I snapped a picture... The environment is also very relaxing and sets a warm ambiance. They&#39;ll definitely be seeing more of me, even if it&#39;s just to pick up a slice of cheesecake!

My husband I came here for our anniversary lunch yesterday. Our state doesn&#39;t have a Cheesecake Factory anywhere so we always go when we are on vacation somewhere. I usually order the same thing since we don&#39;t get to go often (can never go wrong with Oreo cheesecake). As always, the food was great and our server was fantastic as well. Will definitely be back at some point.

Currently waiting for my online order of a single dish. Was supposed to be ready 20 minutes ago. Have called the curbside number twice. No one has brought out the food that I&#39;ve already paid for. Starting to think they didn&#39;t, and aren&#39;t, going to make it. How can I get my money back?
Good food even though it&#39;s a chain restaurant. Plethora of options for carnivores and vegans alike. I like the Thai chicken wraps, their salads and brunch options.

My wife and I went out with my daughter and her nieces and nephews.  I had the impossible burger (plant based) and my wife had the sweet corn tamale cakes, which were unbelievably tasty!  As vegans we always order from the plant based side of the menu, but this might&#39;ve been the 1st time I had a burger that tastes like real meat -  Looking forward to my next visit.

The Cheesecake Factory has a wealth of menu items for every eater. I enjoy their skinny menu items when I prefer a lighter meal. Their customer service is always top notch. The cheesecakes are delicious and plentiful. I always have a great experience dining here, just as I did today. The crab cake bites are delicious and their flatbread pizza is amazing! The only drawback is the excessive wait times depending on the time of day or weekend visits.
They dropped a knife on my lap and my food was Awful! Also my fams food was bad and our waitress was really bad!

The hostesses were less than friendly. When we asked about a reservation for our larger party, we were told they didn&#39;t take reservations but they indeed do. However, it&#39;s at their discretion on whom they decide to book reservations for during the week. The manager gave a less than truthful explanation to the selective reservation booking after we learned the truth from our waiter. Our waiter was great. Our food was ok but the cheeseburger order was less than great. When they had to add the cheese, the cheese was dipped in hot water, that&#39;s clean might I add, them put on top of the burger. The whole process was explained again by our honest waiter. Not to cause a scene or a stir, we laughed and tried to enjoy the rest of our bad dinner. Needless to say, we won&#39;t dine their again but the waiter receive a very nice tip for being honest the entire night. Thanks but no thanks

Amazing meal. Fried zucchini is the best appiterzer ever.  I could make a meal off that.  The brown bread they bring out is wonderful. I just went with a sandwich and it was good, but the mahi mahi is my favorite. Got to have cheesecake if you go, not a fan of cheesecake, but i love it.

Our church staff was in town for a conference and we wanted to go somewhere nice for our last meal before heading home. A couple of people suggested the cheesecake factory and that sounded good. I had not been to the cheesecake factory in several years so I had really forgotten about the extensive menu. When I called it was going to be an hour and a half wait for our group of eight so we split into two groups of four and was seated within 15 to 20 minutes.<br><br>The restaurant was packed but still looked very clean. Everyone that we dealt with was very nice and extremely polite. Our waitress was Anna and she was really amazing.<br><br>On the way to our table a waiter was walking by with two or three dishes that he was about to serve. One of those dishes caught my eye and I said that looks great I wonder what it is? He took the time to turn around and tell me the name of the dish and that&#39;s exactly what I ordered. It was Chicken Parmesan Romano with pasta and a light sauce and it was delicious.<br><br>It was a great evening with some wonderful friends and the restaurant did an excellent job.

The service was great enough!!! I came from Meridian with a party of 14 to celebrate a high accomplishment. We were told the wait would be 3-4 hours. Ridiculous. So we all sat at different tables inside and out. I guess they did the best the could. It was packed. The food was not so great! I sampled everything that came to the table. We had herb crusted salmon and asparagus cooked well. It still lacked taste although it looked great. My mom had Steak Diane cooked medium well, it had to be sent back because it was still too raw and bloody. I had the meatloaf and substituted my corn succotash for carrots, they we&#39;re just cooked, well burnt without seasoning. The meatloaf was pretty good though and so was the potatoes. <br>I won&#39;t be returning, if I want to dine out at this Cheesecake Factory again, I&#39;ll be traveling to Memphis. The food their was delicious!

We went in on busy Saturday night got to sit at the bar. David was bartending and did a very good job. Everything was quick and so good. Should have took some pictures. Will definitely be back when we are in town again.
I had a great server and a very server. Very fast and informative. Asked about sugar content and she brought over a nutritional menu. Taking dessert home and my salad is always good

I love cheesecake factory but this isn&#39;t the best one. The services are so slow every time I visit here. <br><br>I get that hosts can be annoyed by so many people coming up to them, but please don&#39;t be rude to people who are being polite. I used to go to the one in DC all the time and loved it every time. I took my friends who are visiting me here and they told me that not all southerners practice southern hospitality after coming here. <br><br>The portions are huge so we all took half the food back home. The breads are good as well. Lastly, I don&#39;t eat dairy so every time their servers give me a weird look for not ordering a slice of cheesecake, it is painful.

I have to say I am very disappointed in the  Cheese Cake Factory. I had a to go over that was less than spectacular. I&#39;m not sure if it was because it was a to go order or not but the food was horrible. I&#39;m trying yo load a picture of these Tex Mex Egg rolls that looks like they were soaked in grease. I&#39;m not sure this is were you want to eat.

Dinner at my favorite restaurant with my mom  and husband was great.we chose to sit on the patio because the weather was in my opinion perfect.the atmosphere on the patio was very nice and as always the food was sooooo delicious! I can&#39;t wait till my next visit.

I placed an order to be picked up Curbside, sending my husband to the restaurant at the appointed time of 7:05pm. At that time, none of the designated spots were available and the parking lot was so jammed there was no place to even stop to put hazards on. He parked across the street and walked in, went to the counter to pick up our order (it was now 7:25pm), and they said &#34;Get in line,&#34; pointing to a line 50 people deep. He waited for 10 more minutes and with no movement, finally left. I called and spoke to the manager who said she could not give us a refund on the order we never received since we ordered it online, and that we would have to contact the company that runs the online ordering service. After some research and going on the website of said company, I discovered this is NOT true - in fact I found an article telling the restaurant how to refund a customer. I tried calling the manager back and was put on hold for (literally) 20 minutes, after which time I finally hung up. We are now forced to open a dispute on the charge with AMEX, who is great about honoring, but we shouldn&#39;t have to go to that trouble. (And I still have no dinner!!) Clearly, Cheesecake Factory needs to revisit their policies and practices for Curbside orders, limiting the amount of orders taken, as well as be aware of how to refund customers. This was such a headache that we will not return to this restaurant.
Their fried calamari and sweet corn tamale cakes are my favorite appetizers and I usually get the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp as my entree. Every type of cheesecake I have tried has been good.

I love Cheesecake Factory, however my experience at this particular location was less than satisfactory. Firstly, my silverware had food debris. Secondly, my food was prepared incorrectly. I ordered the Chicken Madeira w/ roasted broccoli. The first time, it was brought with asparagus (I&#39;m allergic). The second time, with steamed broccoli, and the third time w/ semi steamed/roasted broccoli and seasoning. At that point, I no longer cared to argue because I understood that my food would not be prepared correctly. My chicken was cold and so were my potatoes. The entire dish should have been prepared over, however they continued to resend out the same dish. In my opinion, it&#39;s not enough to say &#34;your food is free&#34;. No one was apologetic, nor did they care that we were unsatisfied and that they had wasted our time. The managers (James and Jennifer) did not resolve my issue in a matter that would make me return to this location or encourage other people to go.

Food was good, but the wait time was ridiculously long.  It even took forever to get refills on water while we waited on our food.  Manager did come over and apologize.   The cheesecake was the best part of the trip....worth the wait.

I frequent Cheesecake factory because of the quantity of the food and it&#39;s tasty! But what I am not a fan of is that you have to wait so long and they don&#39;t allow you to reserve seating unless you have a large group. It would be nice if they offered the texting notification opposed to the buzzers since the wait time is normally long.

Anna B. Is THE BEST waitress I&#39;ve had IN A LONG TIME! She made sure we always had what we needed, was knowledgeable of the menu, and her positive cheerful attitude was infectious. When my boyfriend was not satisfied with his entree she suggested something else from the menu and he loved it. I loved that she genuinely cared about our experience and it truly made a difference! Thank you Anna<br><br>(Oh and our burgers were amazing too!)

Enjoying a warm and beautiful afternoon at The Cheesecake Factory!  Scenic view, great atmosphere and awesome tasting food you have try to experience! Can&#39;t wait to come back and try something new!
Very unhappy with my experience. Ordered pot stickers to go and was only given 4 potstickers instead of 5. Definitely not worth the money. Will not be ordering again.

My boyfriend and I went to The Cheesecake Factory for my birthday dinner. Our waitress was Jimmiesha. She was a very helpful waitress and gave us some really good recommendations. The only setbacks during our experience there was that there was our waitress got busy at one point and had forgotten to put in our order for the entrées. She came to our table to apologize and offered us complementary soups while we waited for food. I thought that was really nice of her.<br><br>Later on, Jimmiesha was kind enough to get us some to-go bowls for our leftovers and, I assume either because of the late order because it was my birthday and she was aware, she only charged us for the drinks and the appetizers. I guess it was her birthday present to me, or a present to make up for the wait. <br><br>We ended up tipping $30 on a $12 order that should have been around $50. Jimmiesha was extremely nice and I will happily go back to the Cheesecake Factory if I&#39;m seated at one of her tables.

Flies, Bugs, and Insects! They left dirty tables sitting around our table for 30-45 minutes.  There were flies and insects everywhere, evidently attracted to the food on the empty tables.  We spoke with Jennifer, who told us a manager would come by and hear our concerns, but no one ever came by.  <br>Their health dept rating notes problems with failing to &#34;maintain potentially hazardous food at 41 F or below.&#34;

Consistent. ALWAYS consistently great!<br><br>The cheese cake factory started out selling cheesecake. They expanded the business with meals and kept the cheesecake. The reality is that most people go for the entrees and the cheesecake is just a bonus. I rarely even eat cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I mentioned the Cheesecake Factory is consistent. My other favorite attribute is the expansive menu. Most restaurant cut down on menu items to help a kitchen produce more smoothly and efficiently. At the Cheesecake Factory you pay a bit more but you got a ton of menu options . The expansive menu is great for groups because there is something for everyone. <br><br>The food is generally very good. I find that the cheese cake factory is better than other more specialized restaurants. For example, the Cheesecake Factory can make better Cajun inspired cuisine than a Cajun restaurant. (Such as Cajun steamer)<br><br>The interior is nicely decorated; the lightly is casual and comfortable. They have outdoor seating which is nice during the evening when the sub sets.<br><br>A few things enter my mind when considering flaws. First, the menu is full of advertisements. Second, it&#39;s a bit more expensive for comparable dishes at other restaurants . Finally , it gets very crowded and the wait can get pretty long on the weekends. <br><br>In conclusion, the cheesecake is a great &#34;go-to&#34; spot for friends and family. They have something to satisfy everyone, and they do so consistently. It&#39;s a franchise and it&#39;s not really anything spectacular, but it is among the best in the area.

Went for a late lunch on a Saturday. It was pretty busy but we were seated within five minutes. Our server Luis was amazing. Our food came fairly quickly, and everything was hot, fresh, and delicious! We were stuffed after dinner so everyone got a slice of cheesecake to go, which was very tasty later that night. My first trip to the Cheesecake Factory and I will definitely be back!
This is my favorite restaurant in Brimingham. Today was made even better by my server Deven! He was AMAZING!!!!!!
Fabulous food and great selection.<br><br>Always something new to try.<br><br>Love CF!!!

Wow. We had a great lunch. The service was special. The young lady that took care of us was great. I just can&#39;t get out without spending too much money. The food is so good. Candice took a small cheese cake home with her.

Someone asked me what the Cheesecake Factory was. After a little chortle, I said it&#39;s an expensive bite of yumminess.<br><br>As you walk in, you might be greeted by a half-smile from the hostess who is doing her best to accommodate having to find seats for paying customers, when I suspect she really wants to just pull out her phone and take another selfie. We wait a few minutes, not long, and led to our table. Our waiter takes our drink orders. He&#39;s friendly and courteous. We have kids with us, so being nice to them will earn you bonus points (ahem, bigger tip).<br><br>We peruse through the Cheesecake Factory Encyclopedia or better known as &#34;Menu.&#34; You name it. Italian, Asian, American...it&#39;s a United Nations of culinary delight. I settled on the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp, a little Thai craving. It was a peanut-infused, coconut, curry sensation. It wasn&#39;t overpowering, but it also wasn&#39;t bland. The only critique I have is too much pepper on the shrimp. I almost did a little chair dance. <br><br>Others in my party ordered the Buffalo Blasters, and those blasted his socks off. I think he actually did a little chair dance, or his butt was asleep. Who knows. He loved it. Another one in my party ordered the Salmon Wraps. She said they sucked. To be fair, they were on the skinny menu. For this fluffy chick, most things on the skinny menu are inedible. I guess that&#39;s why skinny chicks stay skinny. So she ordered the Salmon BBQ, which she loved. I guess that&#39;s what she mumbled while nom-nom-nom. The kids ordered everything from sliders to Fettuccine Alfredo. For them, if it comes with ketchup, they&#39;re happy.<br><br>Then came dessert and where this overrated place earned four stars. My fat cells definitely did the Macarena when I had some of the Dulce de Leche. It was rich yet light with hints of caramel, vanilla, and freakin&#39; awesomeness. The others ordered the Oreo Cheesecake, Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Cheesecake, and Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Cheesecake. They scarfed them down while singing about unicorns and rainbows.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the world to go to. Getting our table was really quick but it still took 10 minutes for someone to come over and place our drink order. I still don&#39;t understand why there are flies on the window. Not exactly sanitary. This is the second time I&#39;ve been here in two months and there have been flies on the window. <br>We asked for bread and we only received the white bread. They once again did not have any of the multi grain bread. It came towards the end of our meal. <br>Our to go boxes cakes 20 minutes later. I did not receive my box until 10 minutes after my dad. Our check came even later. <br>We got in here at 7:10 and didn&#39;t leave till almost 9:00. <br>I thought the experience would be better than the last time but I seem to keep putting too much faith in this place.

I&#39;ve always love coming here for special occasions and come very often. But my recent visit was very disappointing. I had a party of 10 and waited two hours for a table which was fine because it was a Friday night. But the issue was with the staff and customer service. Our main waitress was decent but we had to wait twenty minutes for bread that we had to flag down a random waiter to get. The other waitress helping her was very rude and had a bad attitude all night. She had rolled her eyes when we asked for her to get ranch or silverware.  I told them it was my birthday and I would like to get a cheesecake, which I received in a to go box, no happy birthday song, and a rushed dinner. The food was good but the customer service was not.
Although I am not a major fan of their food, the drinks and desserts are phenomenal.  There is such a huge selection of cheesecake that you can go into overload but it&#39;s SOOO worth it!

Well...I&#39;ve been here a couple of times and let me start by saying, if you have visited this location in another state, this probably won&#39;t hold up to the standard. We waited about 2 hours to be seated and then once we sat we waited another 20 minutes for our waiter to notice us. The food is alright, I usually only go for the calamari and strawberry lemonade which we had to mee flagging down our waiter to refill. He was pretty awkward with a serious attitude. They had the heaters on outside but kept moving them to accommodate different guest that were hot which left every one else freezing from the wind. I probably won&#39;t be back here for awhile.

To be honest I don&#39;t think anyone really goes to The Cheesecake Factory for their food. On my last visit I ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo and when it came out it was barely warm and had no flavor. Also it was served with egg noodles, not fettuccini noodles. We ordered the red velvet and the oreo dream extreme cheesecake to-go and it was great as usual!

It amazes me how busy this place is. <br>I know it&#39;s nothing more than big corporate chain restaurant. But they are dialed in machine. It&#39;s predictable what you are going to get in terms of service and food. You find that one dish in the massive menu and time to time you crave that dish and deal with the massive crowd and wait to eat there. <br>Yes I am brainwashed by the pre made cheesecake also. <br>But honestly, if it wasn&#39;t a chain restaurant and my bias for them wasn&#39;t there, I would give this place a 4 star.
Great lunch celebration for daughter&#39;s birthday. Loved the Brunch. Mexican eggs with all the fixing. Good cheesecake.

1.5 Stars. <br>We usually love going to the Cheesecake Factory. This experience was pretty awful. It seemed that no one working there knew what they were doing. We called ahead about our large party (10 people) and still waited quite a while to be seated. The person who seated us wasn&#39;t sure where we were supposed to go. The server said the bread wasn&#39;t ready and it finally came out around 45 minutes after we&#39;d been seated. The main problem we had there was our food. It was served all at once and it was cold. Everything: the pasta, steak, burgers, you name it. It was so cold that even the mushrooms on one dish were rubbery! It also didn&#39;t taste as good as most Cheesecake Factory dishes taste. Maybe everyone was in training or management is cutting back on costs-?? [The bathroom hadn&#39;t been cleaned recently, either.] I honestly don&#39;t expect perfection from any place when I eat out, but this was pretty bad. I suppose the main reason I&#39;m leaving only 1.5* stars is the price. To pay that much (it was a lot $) for a &#34;chain fancy place&#34; a customer should expect better service - and DEFINITELY better prepared food. <br>My grade: D- <br>I doubt if we&#39;ll be returning to this location.

This place has the largest most diverse menu of any restaurant I&#39;ve visited. It&#39;s wildly popular and despite its immense size there is almost always a wait. The menu storage area must occupy a significant portion of their square footage.<br>I&#39;ve enjoyed most everything I&#39;ve had, though nothing has been particularly special or had me racing back. This place reminds me of a better version of an Appleby&#39;s or TGI Friday&#39;s at 2x the price.<br>Tonight my wife&#39;s sister and her family took my wife to dinner. My wife is a fan of this place, I think for the selection alone. My wife brought me fish and chips.<br>This dinner portion is huge! The fish was thick and flaky with a tempura style beer batter. The Tatar sauce was good with a hint of lemon. The chips were soggy bag variety fries. <br>She subbed the slaw  for crisp sautéed green beans. They were ok.... I personally prefer my green beans cooked for a day with pork fat.<br>The fish and tarter sauce now stand out; however, <br>what really stands out the most is the nutritional information for this menu item.<br>Ever exceeded all of your caloric intake in a day with one meal? <br>The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Beer Battered Fish and Chips: 2,260 calories as well as 68 grams of saturated fat and 2,870 milligrams of sodium.  That&#39;s what 125% of your daily recommended sodium intake??<br>In the future I will google  nutritional information prior to ordering.<br>Upon further further inspection a number of the menu items at this restaurant are widely recognized for their poor nutritional value. <br>Order carefully.

Worst cheesecake factory I have ever been to and I have been to quite a few all over the country. We went on Easter Sunday. The long wait for table didn&#39;t bother us much but there was no seating and very crowded in the entry area. Once seated our server was not very attentive at all. But due to the large crows understandable. The worst part was the food!!!<br>Ordered steak Diane and it lacked everything. No salt or pepper. No flavor...then I ordered medium rare and got it well done... husband ordered scampi shrimp combo and also hated the lack of flavor from the meal. We are really big fans of the cheesecake factory but after this visit, but after this visit we might have to find a new spot. Definitely won&#39;t be back to this location.

Who knew happy hour could be this happy! We were clearly distracted as our sole purpose for even going to the factory was to share a slice of cheesecake in the midst of our celebration. We however, got lured in and found our way to a high top table in the bar area. The happy hour menu danced in our faces with TONS of reasonably priced/shareable options. We were pleased to see low cocktail prices and ordered a few (cosmo and iced tea). My, oh my, compliments to the bartender- his concoctions were made promptly and tasty. While we were waiting, though we knew we only wanted cheesecake, we went ahead and ordered the buffalo blast appetizer. WHY- we only wanted cheesecake, but still managed to be led by our sense of instant hunger. Needless to say, they were good and gone in 45 minutes between the two of us. We agree the blasts might as well be a full meal versus an appetizer- they are so filing and CF definitely doesn&#39;t skimp on quantity. I would recommend an order of these and maybe a side item or side salad as your meal. Though full, we finally ordered our white chocolate raspberry cheesecake......to go!<br><br>Overall, I would say that Cheesecake Factory has one of the best happy hours in town with lots of app/snack/meal options as well as a special bar menu. The restaurant crowd was not obnoxious by far, but rather quiet. If you can make it down 280 between 4-6pm M-F, you&#39;re sure to leave happy, stuffed or worse; both. My only advice, don&#39;t do what we did, stick to your plan and only go for what you planned to go for...cheesecake.

I know you&#39;re hungry, and I know the idea of over 100 choices on a menu sounds like a great idea. But just don&#39;t do it. This place is highly over priced for extremely mediocre food. I ordered pizza, I mean, how do you manage to ruin that? Well it was completely soggy except for the crust. Inedible. I am pretty sure everything is frozen then cooked. The only saving grace was their salad. I would have tried their cheesecakes which admittedly looked rather amazing, but I was too grossed out by the pizza and the state of my friends fried fish tacos. <br><br>On another note their service was pretty on top of their game, and continuously refilled our drinks. They seemed pretty organized even though it was fairly busy. I would be tempted to go back and try the cheesecake. But honestly other than that, I know it is convenient, but just go to a non chain in town.

This place is ridiculous. I have to wait 15 mins every time I call in to place a to go order. Then when I pull up and tell them I&#39;m already here they expect me to call back and wait another 20 mins to call and remind them I&#39;m here. I get it being the weekends but even on week days it&#39;s like this. The food is amazing of course. But geez. I really bothers me when curb side is offered and they make you walk in to get your food. I like Cheesecake Factory bc I don&#39;t have to walk in. Either this place is under staffed or just lazy <br><br>ANNOYING!!!!!!!!!!

HORRIBLE service. Getting one slice of cheesecake carside should not be a thirty minute ordeal. <br><br>What&#39;s the point of having and advertising carside service if you don&#39;t actually provide it? <br><br>Even then, we had to go inside, which was not much better. A fifteen minute wait for something ready made that was preodered? That&#39;s unacceptable, especially at this price point.

Honestly the worst service ever. Waited about 20 min at our table for us to get greeted while tables that got seated after us got greeted and their drink orders were taken. Then we waited 20 more min after we placed our drink order to actually get the drinks. I know it&#39;s a Saturday night and it is busy but this is unacceptable. Server Makayla B should not be taking the tables she clearly can&#39;t handle. Very disappointed with my experience tonight. Even the host was rude when I went up and told her what was wrong. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience here and I will not be coming back anytime soon.

I try to avoid the Summit and Summit restaurants like the plague, but I was spending time with my Mother and we were there, and hungry, so Cheesecake Factory it was this past Saturday.<br><br>No line, no waiting, and out on the covered patio we went. It did seem like our food and drinks took a hot minute to be delivered. I guess they were bumpin&#39; inside. It was fine though. She had a pina colada and I a strawberry daiquiri (what is this, the beach?) and both were tasty. HOWEVER, prices are not marked and thus we paid $11 per drink. $11 at a chain restaurant?  For ice and rum? Who are you kidding TCF? This ain&#39;t Collins Bar or Bottega or something. This is rinkydink Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I had the Farfelle Garlic Chicken Mushroom Something Something Pasta dish and it was really good. And SUCH a large portion I had enough for lunch again the next day, split with another person. Mom enjoyed her food too.<br><br>It was a pleasant surprise for a chain place. Great food. Our waitress was sweet as pie and it was a good experience. I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way for it, but if I were there shopping, then yes. Hit it up!
Presentation 9. Choices 10. Quality 5. Taste inconsistent 3. Service 7. Just what you would expect.

We drove an hout to find A five hour wait for LUNCH on a Saturday for a party of 6...  no fucking way...  this place doesn&#39;t have good that good... <br><br>I won&#39;t ever even try to come back..

I was so looking forward to a nice lunch. Unfortunately, that never came to fruition. (I reluctantly agreed to eat here because last spring they turned our party of 8 away at 3:30 on a weekday. The restaurant was empty. ???) <br><br>Good things: server was nice and the fried mac and cheese was just how our daughter likes it. <br><br>Not-so-good: fries were undercooked; they sent more that were a bit better, but they still had that raw potato flavor. The strawberry lemonade was thick; like it came from the bottom of the container. At least they took it off our bill. <br><br>Total grossness: We killed 4 flies while we were there. In addition, gnats swarmed our food the entire meal. We brought it to the attention of the person who brought our food and his response was, &#34;Well, it&#39;s summertime.&#34; After our meal we asked to speak to the manager. Jennifer came to our table and was of the same opinion. &#34;We have so many doors and it&#39;s hard to keep them out.&#34; We pointed out that it may be a bit easier if tables were bussed and cleaned in a timely manner. 4 tables sat dirty for at least 20 minutes after the customers left. Her response was that they had a large party in another part of the restaurant. She also said she would send over the general manager, but that never happened. <br><br>We hoped for a nice meal. Instead we had sub-par food, flies/gnats, and an atmosphere of dirty tables. I expect more when paying $70 for lunch for 3 people. It&#39;s a shame. TCF used to be one of our favorite places.
Waited 45mins for chicken fingers and a sandwich. This place is a dump. Awful staff=awful restaurant.
One of our favorite places to eat. There is such variety in food choices and dessert is ALWAYS on point! We even came to eat here after getting engaged! Special place for us!

We went to Cheesecake Factory on Sunday evening. We unfortunately had a bad experience. They messed up our order multiple times and when the manager STEPHANIE came out she was rude and didn&#39;t comp anything. I usually don&#39;t like to complain, but Stephanie was trying to argue about how their green beans usually are hard and undercooked. We have been here multiple times and never have had an issue until this evening.

First time ever. I always wondered how it was inside these dark-ish huge buildings supposed to sell huge cheesecakes. They serve also regular food and not only cheesecakes?? O wow!<br><br>Greatly surprised by the quality of the service even in pick chaotic hours.<br>I actually got a cheesecake and I really liked it. I mean, it wasn&#39;t as the last cheesecake I had in NYC, but it was definitively not too sugary and well made.<br><br>Cocktails actually had some alcohol in the present ingredients!  Nice deal.<br><br>Good place, I&#39;ll go back for further investigaitons

Good experience overall. <br><br>Service: My waitress Courtney was the best. She was very attentive and had a great attitude. <br><br>Food: Started things off with the endive salad which was good but had a little too much blue cheese. For the main course I had the Bistro shrimp pasta which looked appetizing and was very delicious. The shrimp were cooked perfectly and melded great with the mushrooms. For desert I had the strawberry short cake. My advice, stick with the cheesecake. The shortcake itself was dense and tasted as though it was fried. I was looking forward to something light and refreshing and it was the opposite. Very disappointed. <br><br>Ambiance:  always extremely busy on a Friday night. Wait wasn&#39;t too long though.

If you&#39;re smart don&#39;t go to the cheesecake factory during dinner hours unless you wish to wait at the minimum 45 minutes. I went during lunch and was seated right away. They have a little lunch menu which is very handy given that their regular menu is so extensive . I went with the Mexican lettuce wraps which came in the shape of tacos making it easier to eat. Also, I had a white sangria. The sangria had mostly oranges in it for the fruit and was good. But what made me the happiest was the gluten-free Godiva chocolate cheesecake. With good service and good food I can&#39;t complain.

I was very excited to grab some pasta with my boyfriend on a Friday afternoon. Unfortunately the food was not appetizing at all. I had the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and my boyfriend had the 4 cheese pasta with chicken. Both dishes lacked seasoning and flavor, and the chicken tasted boiled. I love The Cheesecake Factory, but I will not be eating their pasta anymore.

I normally don&#39;t eat at Cheesecake Factories because the food is chain food, but these guys really helped me out when I called just before their closing time as I was traveling through town, and they made the food and then handed it to me 45 minutes after they closed. I very much appreciated that and it made my night as I had been busy with work all day and did not have time to eat, and wanted to get to my next hotel in Tuscaloosa. <br><br>The food may not be what I would normally eat, but these guys made up for anything by helping me out.

I really enjoy the food here but sometimes, the waiting time to get seated is extremely long. This time, the wait time was 1 hour and 30 minutes to get seated and maybe another 20 minutes to receive the food. I ordered the Chinese chicken salad, one of my favorite salads at Cheesecake Factory. I also ordered the Vanilla Bean cheesecake as a desert. Another part I dislike is that the food, especially the cheesecake, is very expensive compared to the cost of production. Yet, I definitely recommend people visit this restaurant.
Ordered 2 cheesecake slices to-go &amp; they gave us the wrong flavors! Never been so excited to go here for the first time &amp; I could not be more disappointed.

The pasta carbonara is always a good choice. Love the fried calamari appetizer. This location is crazy busy during the weekend but the staff si friendly and things move pretty fast. Really nice outdoor seating available.

One of my favorite places to eat is the Cheesecake factory. The staff is very friendly and they recommend the substitutions and specials.<br>For more details on this restaurant and its yummylicious menu go to my blog<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Flifewithoutalu.blogspot.com%2F2016%2F02%2Fa-special-day.html&amp;s=438d7db5bd7e3fd055a708df5641824a17c796d93532ae64c31a66dfb26b3354" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">lifewithoutalu.blogspot.…</a><br><br>Or follow me at Twitter @debjani_moitra

This evening was one of my worst dining experiences. I ordered a hamburger, and specifically asked for no mayonnaise. When it finally arrived, I immediately noticed the bun was covered in it. The manager, Nick, stopped by the table to see if everyone&#39;s food was fine. I mentioned my original request, and he quickly took the plate back to the kitchen and said he would take care of it. He arrives back shortly after with the &#34;new&#34; burger. I lift up the bun and burger, which still has mayonnaise on it. It had clearly been wiped off and still on the same burger. The waitress came back and asked if it was alright, and I explained the burger still had mayonnaise. She told me that they just replaced the bun, not the burger, and took it back. The manager then comes back and tells me the burger never had mayonnaise on it, and that they &#34;sprinkled mozzarella cheese on top.&#34; I told him that that was not part of the description, and regardless the bottom still had mayonnaise and I could tell it had been wiped off. He then proceeded to tell me that it never had mayonnaise on it in the first place, and says &#34;I&#39;m not going to argue with you, but I looked at it under the light,&#34; and then stormed off. The waitress then returned to the table to apologize and let me know she forgot to let the kitchen know not to put mayonnaise, and told me that indeed, the burger had mayonnaise, contrary to Nick&#39;s response... Nick was extremely rude and unprofessional. I was with a group celebrating a friend&#39;s birthday, and we were appalled with how he handled the situation. The waitress was extremely sweet and I asked her to just cancel my order. By this point, I was upset that the manager would accuse me of lying, and everyone was finished eating and ordering dessert. The waitress then sent another manager over (I didn&#39;t catch his name), and he was very apologetic. He handled the situation great and apologized for our experience. Had it been this manager who came by the first time, I would have no complaints regarding our visit.
First time going it was worth the wait. Great food, awesome cheesecakes. Loved everything about the place

Do you like eating sugar in the dark?  Come here!<br><br>But seriously, if I have to pull out my phone to read the menu, YOUR LIGHTS ARE TOO LOW.<br><br>Cheesecake factory does cheesecake pretty well, and they should... it&#39;s their name.  However, everything else this franchise does, it fails at.<br><br>Even stopping in for dessert and coffee, I find myself completely let down.  This last time, I ordered a Carmel Macchiato and it came to the table with not only caramel as expected, but sugar added as well?  It should be plenty sweet with just the caramel, but even if the person making it felt like it should be sweeter, give me the OPTION to add the sweetener.  I nearly gagged trying to finish the lukewarm drink.<br><br>I just don&#39;t have anything good to say about this place.  The cheesecake almost redeems it, but there are plenty of cheesecake factory franchises that deserve business more than this one.
Great cheesecake, average food. Salads are great. <br><br>Prefer just for dessert

The Cheesecake Factory has easily become my favorite restaurant. From the customer service from the staff to the food, it is a total experience you will not forget.<br><br>I recommend if you love cheesecake to try the red velvet cheesecake there.<br><br>The only down fall of the restaurant is the wait. Easily, the restaurant fills up quickly and the wait turns into 2 to 2 1/2 hour wait for a party of 2.<br><br>Other than that, the food is great and the service is great as well.

I&#39;ve had countless birthday dinners here. It is my trusty go to for finicky friends because the menu is so large they always have something some picky eater will enjoy. My go to is always the chicken piccata, although it&#39;s super heavy on calories, it tastes light and flavorful. Pro-tip- add Cajun shrimp for a game changer. It pairs really well with the lemony wine sauce.

I went to Cheesecake Factory a couple weeks ago and it was a very good experience overall!  We waited a long time to get in, but it was Friday night and we had a large party, so that was to be expected.  Our waitress was phenomenal; I&#39;m pretty sure she had a photographic memory and she didn&#39;t write down any of our party of 10&#39;s orders, which made us a bit skeptical because some of us had specifications, but she didn&#39;t miss anything.  I got the California Guacamole Salad, which had avocado, corn, black beans, radishes, and avocado dressing.  It was a huge salad and was very good, I&#39;d go back to get it in a heartbeat.  The Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake was absolutely to die for, it was so decadent for a non-chocolate containing dessert.  Overall, the whole experience was wonderful!
I never come here for the food because it&#39;s average at best, but the place is names cheesecake factory not food factory, and the name is what they do best.
Ordered the &#34;big burrito&#34;. Should really be called a &#34;rice burrito&#34;. 90 percent rice, 10 percent everything else. Horrible.

The food was okay but the service could have been much better.  So I am giving it a &#34;ok&#34; rating.<br><br>The waiter was managing three tables of different parties at the same time.  No joke.  I have never had a waiter who was telling us ALL that the bread would be coming soon.  <br><br>Also, the waiter told us the specials.  I asked about the salmon special.  Then he showed me the salmon listings.  I asked about the special pricing.  There was none.  So I said, there is really not a special on the salmon, just the everyday fresh salmon that they normally have.  <br><br>The complementary bread was good.  My sister ordered the fried cheese appetizer; it was cut into triangles - how unique -- it tasted fine.<br><br>I ordered the firecracker salmon wrap for $1 more than the low-calorie salmon wrap. The low-calorie salmon wrap was noted as using butter or cream.  I was confused as to how this low-calorie wrap could be healthier than the other wrap.  I asked the waiter what is the difference between the two.  He said the firecracker wrap was bigger.  I did not feel like he had a good answer.  My dishes was loaded with lettuce garnish.<br><br>The caramel pecan turtle cheesecake was to go as I cannot eat it all in one setting.  I little bit can go a long way.  It was fine.  I could not tell there is pecan.  The chocolate flower and whipped cream stole the show. <br><br>I can live without it.

I visited this location on a Saturday.  After barely surviving Dante&#39;s parking lot with my sanity intact, the wait was shorter than it looked. The hostess seated us - with an attitude and expression usually reserved for certain biblical plagues - at a tiny table  practically jammed flush with two other tables. I was almost touching the people next to me on either side. It was awkward, uncomfortable and I felt showed a contempt for the customer. <br><br>The food was average and overpriced. I&#39;ve had better hamburgers at burger king, and almost all of what I saw on their phonebook sized menu read like the Stouffer&#39;s section at your local grocery. <br><br>If you&#39;re in an indecisive party of shopping-fueled masochists, this place has a little bit of every cuisine known to humanity. If you&#39;re looking for a comfortable place to enjoy some good food and a relatively private conversation, look elsewhere.

We reserved table for 15 Senior Adults from Church. Table was ready as promised. We had several appetizers, entrees and Deserts. All were delicious!!!  Maria our server did a wonderful job of taking care of us. Very successful outing for our Senior Adults.

This place always has great food, but for some reason they never have the cheesecake I want to order and if you sit outside their service can be slower than normal. Make sure to call and make a reservation before you go if you visit after 6 and are a bigger group than 5 or you&#39;ll be waiting an hour to be seated.

You know what you&#39;re getting coming in, so grumbling about canned smiles and homogenized food is senseless.  We&#39;ve been here several times and have always enjoyed the food, even if my stomach doesn&#39;t, but that&#39;s just because I&#39;m not a regular consumer of butter.  Almost everything here is very rich, but you&#39;re prepared for that already because you&#39;ve probably already picked out your cheesecake before getting here.    I know I do, but I can only eat half a slice before wanting to die.  <br><br>We usually ask for a booth and have always been accommodated.  This time we were too hungry and they were too busy (because we foolishly showed up in the middle of a holiday weekend), so the first place they put us was the long strip of tiny tables in the middle of the floor where your elbows bump with your neighbor&#39;s the whole time.  Here you get dinner AND a show.  A man sitting three inches from me asked as many questions as he could about the menu to the flustered waitress, but the odd thing was that 90% of these questions were about chicken fingers on the kid&#39;s menu (there were no kids with him).  He studied the menu like it was Proust, meticulously going through everything, running his finger up and down it and umming and ahhing over everything.  After a long time of this the pressure got to him and he ordered a burger and fries.  Meanwhile, at my other elbow, a sour, silent couple emitted bitter energy into the atmosphere as she glared at the kitchen door with impatience for the entire time it took him to down two beers and order a third.  <br><br>Keep your expectations realistic.  You&#39;re in for really good cheesecake and a safe, predictable and slightly over-priced meal of buttery pasta or fries or ceasar salads or any  of that usual stuff people get at these places.

Not my favorite cheesecake factory location, if only because it&#39;s unnecessarily crowded... or maybe the waitstaff is actually just overtaxed.   Either way, it leaves for a fairly mediocre experience on a given weekend.<br><br>I&#39;ll suggest a revamp of some of the appetizer options as well; it should be hard to mess up crab wontons (aka rangoons) and everybody knows guac--especially the fresh variety--needs a little salt to make it spark. <br><br>The Jamaican black pepper shrimp and miso salmon are still good, though I kinda miss the old school skirt steak that used to be in place of the shrimp.   All in all, better cheesecake locations in Atlanta, Nashville and uh, even the one in Denver... But there are a ton more interesting places to eat in either of those places too.
Calorie dense and crowded. This is a perfect place to go to get fat. With that said, the dulce de leche cheesecake is worth wearing your elastic waistbands.

I love the Cheesecake Factory but this location is a little unclean. Our silverware and bread plates were dirty. And we watched them bus a table and they just rewrapped unused silverware in new napkins. But it was still touched by other patrons. There were flies everywhere and it just felt generally kinda dirty. The food was still decent.

Yesterday I tried something different from The Cheesecake Factory..... YeS!!! Bang Bang Chicken &amp;Shrimp!!!! I always have a great experience here. The staff is very professional, not a long wait, and the food is always hot. Something I really love about this place is how the food is presented. It&#39;s a work of ART! :)
We always enjoy our trip to the Cheesecake Factory but I gave it three stars as the stuffed chicken tortillas could not be cut with a fork. I had to use a knife! Still tasted good.

We ate here for Valentine&#39;s day one year.<br><br>The food was just ok and way overpriced which is why they only get two stars in my book. My husband got the steak Diane, and because of how much he disliked it anytime he sees that on a menu or on T.V. he replies with &#34;ugghh&#34;.<br><br>Now the cheesecake, this coming from a person who has never really liked cheesecake, was really good! The slices are huge and they have great flavor choices. I remember the Snickers being my favorite.

When I came in it was crowded the host was very rude and ready to be done with me . We waited for 20 minuets that&#39;s pretty  normal at therestaurant. Our waiter was very sweet no problem here body odor was very unpleasant. I got the turkey burger , I thought it was tuna at first from how it smelled but overall the food was good. They do need to wash there cups better cause I was very hesitant to drink because the straw was  without paper on top. I got the strawberry lemonade and it was very sour and needed a lot of water , I don&#39;t know if there trying to give me diabetes from all that sugar in it. Great location. You need a jacket if you come very cold , made me feel like I was in a ice box.
Sat at the bar - bartenders could not have been more prompt or friendly! Service and food were great.  No complaints!

We go here on a regular basis. Long wait Friday &amp; Saturday nights, but that&#39;s to be expected. So many things to choose from on the menu. One thing I really love about CF is that they are very accommodating to people with small children. When my 3 year old was younger, they would bring him a plate of bread &amp; cut up bananas for free! This is brilliant in so many ways. Treat the kids right &amp; the parents will keep coming back. My husband &amp; I have a few things a piece that we really like to order, but sometimes try new things. We are rarely disappointed. Service can range from great to ok, but never very poor. And then there&#39;s the cheesecake.... Need I say more?

Visited on a very busy Sunday,  even with the long wait it was totally worth it.  The food was good as always and very filling. The desert was even better. I had the calamari for appetizer, as it never seems to disappoint,  the four cheese pasta with Chicken, a sweet tea that was sweet, but not so filled with sugar that I would end up with diabetes.....I topped it all off with the new Celebration Cheesecake and it was ever so delious and appealing to my ever changing taste buds. The visit was very much a success with good food and even better service. No complaints here,  5 stars!

Did take out this time. Took awhile to answer the phone but when they did, it was very quick and professional. The super antioxidant salad was very good, the Shepards pie is always a hit and the meatloaf was spot on as usual.
Just stopped in for some cheesecake and a drink, great service! Great atmosphere, great drinks and amazing cheesecake! Will come again for sure!

Best burger in town in my opinion is their Kobe Burger. It&#39;s super tender and juicy and an awesome unique flavor to it. Only reason this place doesn&#39;t get 5 stars is because its always super packed, TV&#39;s are tiny, and the cheesecake is so expensive.

Probably won&#39;t be back. I came in at 11 not a busy time at all, and I was seated on the long bench that is meant for groups of people, I was just one person. I don&#39;t appreciate being put where I have no privacy what so ever. By the time I left the whole bench area was full and I had no room to even move. There are small tables you could sit one person at. The long benches are meant for groups. Not party&#39;s of 1.

Horrible EXPERIENCE....We waited 2 1/2 hours to be seated...Once inside we waited another 2 HOURS to receive our meal...Food wasnt great but cheeseburger didn&#39;t disappoint.....Our server was inexperienced and needed more training...I would NEVER visit again....I did notify the manager of the issues and NOTHING was corrected.....The manager seem like she had other issues to worry about than entertain mine....SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!! FYI CHEESECAKE LINE WAS A MILE LONG

We are visiting a friend of ours in Birmingham and decided to go to our favorite chain restaurant, The Cheesecake Factory, we walk in and as usual the wait is long but we don&#39;t mind. We are added to the list and said to be waiting 25-30 minutes which was okay with us since it was absolutely freezing outside. The male host, Chris, said we were able to try and get to one of the side tables as they were first come first serve. A table got up and as i was sitting down, 4 young women jumped right in front of me and told me the male host, Chris, said we can take this table. I went back to him telling him i was already sitting and he said it was too bad in a rather rude way. At this point i am a bit pissed but i brush it off because i am visiting some old friends. The first time our buzzer went off, we took it and Chris said the &#34;battery was dead&#34; and told us to wait another 10 minutes which we were okay with. The second time it went off, Chris, the male host said that &#34;they have been trying to buzz us for 10 minutes and no reply&#34; which was unusual because we were standing right in front of the desk the whole time and our buzzer never went off until then. The male host told us to wait about 10 minutes which turned out to be another 30. At this point we are a bit dissatisfied and furious at this point. We are then seated and a our waitress is quite pleasant. Our waitress Jane, a truly enjoyable person, always came to check up on us to make sure everything was alright. I ordered one of the simple burgers and everything was great but the fries. The fries just happened to extremely salty. My friend had an avocado egg roll and she enjoyed it. My other friend had ordered the four-cheeses pasta which she also enjoyed. Everything else seemed to be alright. It was just the beginning of our dining experience that made us a bit furious as we drove an hour to have dinner here and we were completely ignored the majority of the time. Will probably not be back. As long as Chris still works here.

My go to restaurant when one is available, because the food is always delicious and there are a lot of options to choose from.  I like the fried macaroni and cheese appetizer and mix up my entree from one visit to the next.  the small Greek salad with grilled chicken is enough for a meal for myself,  especially if I&#39;m having cheesecake (which I would never skip)! this location is small.  we arrived 15 minutes prior to the restaurant opening, and there was already a crowd gathered.   We were seated immediately,  but by the time we were finished eating there were several families waiting.  Service was quick and friendly.  Hope to be back soon!

The wait at this location is very long. Doesn&#39;t matter if it&#39;s lunch or dinner, weeknight or weekend. It really doesn&#39;t seem to matter if it&#39;s even crowded, it just seems to take forever to get a table. OBVIOUSLY, if you are only going to get a slice for dessert, as we have, it&#39;s much quicker, and that is a different review. The cheesecake is good. Very good. The rest of the food is the bigger issue.I have yet to have an entrée that blew me away, The prices are higher than average,and I think you must pay for the name or the novelty, because I don&#39;t think the quality of food is worth it. We will go there solely for dessert from now on.

Service and quality are really what makes a difference when you eat at a chain restaurant. I&#39;ve been to several cheesecake factory locations in california as well as in Texas. This place however was the first ive ever run into that was DIRTY! <br><br>Went to lunch there today. There was no wait for the patio so coworker and I decided to sit outside. It was nice out today! Sat down, got some bread (which weren&#39;t warm as they usually are, the sourdough usually looses its warmth quick but neither roll was warm) opened the napkin roll to get a knife, only to find out my napkin had been used and the silverware was rolled with crumbs. Odd?! Now my coworkers napkin was clean but it had crumbs in it as well... Oh well Maybxe it fell in the basket of bread along with some shrimp tail and sauce on my napkin....gross!<br><br>While waiting for our food i saw that the table next to us was being prepped the guy was arranging the little plates...then i noticed (through the window and glare! might i add) that one of the plates was obviously dirty...they guy ignored it and placed the napkin over it logistically so you wont notice any of that gunk!. I wasnt tripping that SHHHT WAS DIRTY. Like i just had a salad with some tomatoes and green onions dirty! It wasn&#39;t just a speck. I cant believe he just ignored it like it wasnt there, like no one would notice. Seriously?! You&#39;re that lazy?<br><br>To add they forgot the onion strings on my salad :( why? it&#39;s like the best part. Crunchy unhealthy fried onions mmmmm :) so the expediter wasnt any help which their case. <br><br>I asked for the manager and told him about the nasty napkin and the nasty plate that was on the booth inside next to us...By then a lovely family had sat down on that booth but the lady wasnt having any bread lol so she hasn&#39;t seen the NASTY plate. The manager swiftly went to the table and grabbed all the plates from that table. Good job! Other than that i really dont know if he talked to his employee...<br><br>He told me that the prep their utensils outside of their kitchen area. I told him maybe they should pick a more sanitary place to work and roll those napkins.<br><br>Oh and if you wanted to know the manager did comp our food, not that we cared for him to do that. We were on a company lunch and i really just wanted him to tell his lazy employee to pick up his act and not make their team look bad.

Service is horrible and management doesn&#39;t care.  Had bad service two days in a row; I won&#39;t be bothered a third time as my lesson has been learned.  The staff is rude or just flat out ignores you and management doesn&#39;t care.   Avoid and just go to Pappadeaux&#39;s.

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory but I cannot rate higher than 2 stars for my latest experience. First, let me clarify that I work in the restraunt industry and I am also an avid cook. I know food prep and I know when its bad.<br><br>We called ahead and were quoted a 45-1 hour wait but when we got there, we were quoted 20-30 which was excellent. However, we were seated at an incredibly small table where one wall was booths and the other were chairs. Besides the 2 of us, there were 3 other people on the booth seating and it was cramped to say the least. I understand you want to seat as many tables as possible, but breaking up a 4 top for a 2 top is not a solution when they have no elbow room.<br><br>Bread and butter were meager, disappointing as they used to have harty portions. We placed our orders after much debate--he got catfish, I got some pasta (can&#39;t recall the name, it was a penne pasta with mushrooms and wine sauce.) I asked to substitute noodles for angel hair and our server was happy to do so. Sadly, my pasta was AWFUL. The noodles were so overcooked, it was hard to chew them they were so sticky and crunchy all at one. The sauce was also improperly reduced and still had a bitter, acrid aftertaste that told me they had not cooked out the alcohol. After lots of debate, I finally sent it back and ordered a burger instead. The burger was good, but I asked for it to be cooked medium well and it was well done to say the least. My fiance&#39;s catfish was good but he found multiple &#34;corn hairs&#34; in his vegetables (which tells me they did not shuck the corn properly) and his fish&#39;s breading fell away when he touched a piece. Really disappointing, considering our bill was about $70 with the tip.<br><br>The only reason this isn&#39;t 1 Star is because our server was superb. I believe her name was Charlie---long blond hair, very sweet. She was very apologetic and speedy and kept our drinks full. Such a shame their staff seems to be amazing on the floor but sub-par at best in the kitchen.

You&#39;ve heard the phrase &#34;eat local.&#34; This is the opposite.<br><br>I think people dine here because they are impressed by the decor. The interior is spacious, even lavish. <br><br>It should be great, right?<br><br>Service is attentive &amp; pleasant. No issues there.<br><br>There&#39;s only one problem: the food pretty much sucks.<br><br>I daresay that if you served this food in a &#39;hole in the wall&#39; type of location, it would be out of business in a month.<br><br>Most of this stuff seems to have originated in a can, mix, or freezer.<br><br>It can either be bland, too sweet, or too spicy.<br><br>The &#39;green salad&#39; consists of a bowl of lettuce doused in lousy bland dressing.<br><br>The &#39;chicken mushroom lettuce wraps&#39; are grossly overseasoned.<br><br>It&#39;s not cheap, either.<br><br>I don&#39;t mind paying for good food. <br><br>This is not good food.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory was probably good when it started, many years ago. Then it became more of a &#34;factory&#34; (hey, at least they are honest). It&#39;s an example of a chain restaurant that has embraced mediocrity and style over substance.<br><br>There may be some desirable items on the menu, but I&#39;ve had no luck finding them.<br><br>I really don&#39;t understand dining here when there are so many better options in Birmingham. Heck, there are at least a half dozen better options within a mile.<br><br>Waiting any length of time to dine here is just plain sad.<br><br>I am being generous in giving this place two stars.

My husband and I aren&#39;t typically a fan of chains but the food at the cheesecake factory was fresh and delicious. We sat at the bar and our bartender was awesome knowledgeable of the menu and fast! Of course the cheesecake was to die for with the Dulce de Leche and the traditional with strawberries. The tie wrap appetizer was phenomenal and big enough for a meal. The waitstaff  worked together flawlessly to make our  experience awesome. Would definitely go back.
I followed the instructions provided and submitted my information, but have not heard from anyone.

Went tonight and as usual had a great experience. There was about a 30 minute wait which was a surprise being that it was a Wednesday. Our server was kind and quick. I ordered the factory burrito grande like I always do and was as usual satisfied. My only complaint is that the restaurant was too cold so it made me want to leave quickly.
No! Skip it, nothing but slow service, slow food, and rude management. If you want corporate, crap food, then sure go here.

Don&#39;t ever attempt to call a to go order in on a weekend. You&#39;ll get put on hold and sent to a phone that no one ever answers. I was on hold tonight twice for 15 minutes each time and I only waited that long the second time because it was almost comical at that point. This isn&#39;t the first time this has happened, either. I&#39;ll give them three stars because the food is decent and the cheesecake is good but it always seems like they are understaffed and the service suffers.

When you want a large selection of items on the menu (Salads, Appetizers, Italian, Burgers, Cajun, Asian Fusion, Steaks, Comfort, Desert, etc.) go here. If I want consistency in drinks and food, I&#39;m never dissapointed. If its crowded and you don&#39;t mind a slightly busy atmosphere, first come first serve in the bar area! If you&#39;re too full for dessert, some meals are dinosaur portions, take the cheesecake home for layer. It keeps very well. Anyways, I agree wholeheartedly with other reviewers... certainly consistent in quality!
The food is really lacking in flavor... I get the same thing every time.. I will stick with cheese cake only..

I had an awful experiment with my to go meal but they manager assured me he would take care of everything he offered to remake the food (which I declined) and gave me a refund he even through in a free slice of cheesecake for all my trouble.
Ordered take out pasta and they somehow forgot to put the sauce on my pasta. It wasn&#39;t edible. Complete was of money.

Everyone knows the factory had a huge menu. After much debate I decided to try the seared turns steak. Big mistake. The tuna was cooked all the way through (usually served seared and very rare), and was dry and fishy tasting. The rest of the dishes were ok but not worth the hype this chain receives. I was very disappointed and haven&#39;t been back. There are so many other better restaurants in the area in the same price range id rather spend the money on.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory after a 2 year hiatus due to terrible service! Well not very much has changed in that time. I was with co-workers from my employer who was treating us to a Holiday Meal, our entire department was there. We sat in two columns of tables against the long communal booth with chairs. One half of our tables got their entree&#39;s in a timely fashion. Our half of the tables waited an additional 20 minutes and our waiter who seemed dyslexic, listless, basically present in body and absent in mind disappeared into thin air! Our entree&#39;s sat in the kitchen and were lukewarm at best when they FINALLY arrived to the table; for heaven sakes all I ordered was the Fresh Grilled Salmon, broccoli, and subbed Mashed Potatoes for Brown Rice (Lunch Serving) not very difficult! I finally got my lukewarm entree 20-30 minutes after I ordered. I believed this to be the same young man who waited on me personally two years before and resulted in a 2-year hiatus! He disappeared and our entree&#39;s sat to get cold! Our director was pissed and so were some of my other co-workers. He didn&#39;t offer any apologies nor did he involve a manager, just as he didn&#39;t the last time I had the displeasure of his service! I was so done with the experience I darted back out and down the road to work! You just don&#39;t expect such an experience. Last time I had this displeasure I didn&#39;t write a review anywhere, this time I had to let others know!

By far the WORST eggs Benedict I&#39;ve ever had!  Eggs were hard boiled. Yuck!  Fruit looked like it was 5 days old. The blue berries tasted like bananas.
